module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.BufferingHints

-- | Describes hints for the buffering to perform before delivering data to
--   the destination. These options are treated as hints, and therefore
--   Kinesis Data Firehose might choose to use different values when it is
--   optimal. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data BufferingHints
BufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> BufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is
--   optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a
--   value for <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>, and vice versa.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MiB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MiB or higher.
[$sel:sizeInMBs:BufferingHints'] :: BufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300.
--   This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must
--   also specify a value for <tt>SizeInMBs</tt>, and vice versa.
[$sel:intervalInSeconds:BufferingHints'] :: BufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BufferingHints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:BufferingHints'</a>, <a>bufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a>
--   - Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before
--   delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This
--   parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also
--   specify a value for <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>, and vice versa.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MiB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MiB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:BufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>bufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming data for the
--   specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the
--   destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but
--   if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt>, and vice versa.
newBufferingHints :: BufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is
--   optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a
--   value for <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>, and vice versa.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MiB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MiB or higher.
bufferingHints_sizeInMBs :: Lens' BufferingHints (Maybe Natural)

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,

-- | Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery

data CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The CloudWatch group name for logging. This value is required if
--   CloudWatch logging is enabled.
[$sel:logGroupName:CloudWatchLoggingOptions'] :: CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | The CloudWatch log stream name for logging. This value is required if
--   CloudWatch logging is enabled.

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand

-- | Describes a <tt>COPY</tt> command for Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyCommand</a> smart constructor.
data CopyCommand
CopyCommand' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> CopyCommand

-- | Optional parameters to use with the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt>
--   command. For more information, see the "Optional Parameters" section
--   of <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command</a>. Some possible examples that
--   would apply to Kinesis Data Firehose are as follows:
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '\t' lzop;</tt> - fields are delimited with "\t" (TAB
--   character) and compressed using lzop.
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|'</tt> - fields are delimited with "|" (this is the
--   default delimiter).
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|' escape</tt> - the delimiter should be escaped.
--   
--   <tt>fixedwidth
--   'venueid:3,venuename:25,venuecity:12,venuestate:2,venueseats:6'</tt> -
--   fields are fixed width in the source, with each width specified after
--   every column in the table.
--   
--   <tt>JSON 's3://mybucket/jsonpaths.txt'</tt> - data is in JSON format,
--   and the path specified is the format of the data.
--   
--   For more examples, see <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command examples</a>.
[$sel:copyOptions:CopyCommand'] :: CopyCommand -> Maybe Text

-- | A comma-separated list of column names.
[$sel:dataTableColumns:CopyCommand'] :: CopyCommand -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the target table. The table must already exist in the
--   database.
[$sel:dataTableName:CopyCommand'] :: CopyCommand -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyCommand</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyOptions:CopyCommand'</a>, <a>copyCommand_copyOptions</a> -
--   Optional parameters to use with the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt>
--   command. For more information, see the "Optional Parameters" section
--   of <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command</a>. Some possible examples that
--   would apply to Kinesis Data Firehose are as follows:
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '\t' lzop;</tt> - fields are delimited with "\t" (TAB
--   character) and compressed using lzop.
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|'</tt> - fields are delimited with "|" (this is the
--   default delimiter).
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|' escape</tt> - the delimiter should be escaped.
--   
--   <tt>fixedwidth
--   'venueid:3,venuename:25,venuecity:12,venuestate:2,venueseats:6'</tt> -
--   fields are fixed width in the source, with each width specified after
--   every column in the table.
--   
--   <tt>JSON 's3://mybucket/jsonpaths.txt'</tt> - data is in JSON format,
--   and the path specified is the format of the data.
--   
--   For more examples, see <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command examples</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTableColumns:CopyCommand'</a>,
--   <a>copyCommand_dataTableColumns</a> - A comma-separated list of column
--   names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTableName:CopyCommand'</a>,
--   <a>copyCommand_dataTableName</a> - The name of the target table. The
--   table must already exist in the database.
newCopyCommand :: Text -> CopyCommand

-- | Optional parameters to use with the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt>
--   command. For more information, see the "Optional Parameters" section
--   of <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command</a>. Some possible examples that
--   would apply to Kinesis Data Firehose are as follows:
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '\t' lzop;</tt> - fields are delimited with "\t" (TAB
--   character) and compressed using lzop.
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|'</tt> - fields are delimited with "|" (this is the
--   default delimiter).
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|' escape</tt> - the delimiter should be escaped.
--   
--   <tt>fixedwidth
--   'venueid:3,venuename:25,venuecity:12,venuestate:2,venueseats:6'</tt> -
--   fields are fixed width in the source, with each width specified after
--   every column in the table.
--   
--   <tt>JSON 's3://mybucket/jsonpaths.txt'</tt> - data is in JSON format,
--   and the path specified is the format of the data.
--   
--   For more examples, see <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command examples</a>.
copyCommand_copyOptions :: Lens' CopyCommand (Maybe Text)

-- | A comma-separated list of column names.
copyCommand_dataTableColumns :: Lens' CopyCommand (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the target table. The table must already exist in the
--   database.
copyCommand_dataTableName :: Lens' CopyCommand Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.CopyCommand.CopyCommand

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | Describes the buffering to perform before delivering data to the
--   Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchBufferingHints
ElasticsearchBufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
[$sel:sizeInMBs:ElasticsearchBufferingHints'] :: ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5
--   minutes).
[$sel:intervalInSeconds:ElasticsearchBufferingHints'] :: ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:ElasticsearchBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchBufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a> - Buffer incoming data to
--   the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination.
--   The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:ElasticsearchBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming
--   data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
newElasticsearchBufferingHints :: ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
elasticsearchBufferingHints_sizeInMBs :: Lens' ElasticsearchBufferingHints (Maybe Natural)

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5
--   minutes).
elasticsearchBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds :: Lens' ElasticsearchBufferingHints (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchBufferingHints.ElasticsearchBufferingHints

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchRetryOptions
ElasticsearchRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of
--   time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including
--   the first attempt). After this time has elapsed, the failed documents
--   are written to Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A
--   value of 0 (zero) results in no retries.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:ElasticsearchRetryOptions'] :: ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchRetryOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:ElasticsearchRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - After an initial
--   failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of time during which
--   Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including the first attempt).
--   After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A value of 0
--   (zero) results in no retries.
newElasticsearchRetryOptions :: ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of
--   time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including
--   the first attempt). After this time has elapsed, the failed documents
--   are written to Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A
--   value of 0 (zero) results in no retries.
elasticsearchRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' ElasticsearchRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchRetryOptions.ElasticsearchRetryOptions

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureDescription</a> smart constructor.
data FailureDescription
FailureDescription' :: DeliveryStreamFailureType -> Text -> FailureDescription

-- | The type of error that caused the failure.
[$sel:type':FailureDescription'] :: FailureDescription -> DeliveryStreamFailureType

-- | A message providing details about the error that caused the failure.
[$sel:details:FailureDescription'] :: FailureDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':FailureDescription'</a>, <a>failureDescription_type</a>
--   - The type of error that caused the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:FailureDescription'</a>,
--   <a>failureDescription_details</a> - A message providing details about
--   the error that caused the failure.
newFailureDescription :: DeliveryStreamFailureType -> Text -> FailureDescription

-- | The type of error that caused the failure.
failureDescription_type :: Lens' FailureDescription DeliveryStreamFailureType

-- | A message providing details about the error that caused the failure.
failureDescription_details :: Lens' FailureDescription Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.FailureDescription.FailureDescription


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HECEndpointType

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe

-- | The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose
--   for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format
--   in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one
--   offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX
--   SerDe.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHiveJsonSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data HiveJsonSerDe
HiveJsonSerDe' :: Maybe [Text] -> HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Indicates how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to parse the date and
--   timestamps that may be present in your input data JSON. To specify
--   these format strings, follow the pattern syntax of JodaTime's
--   DateTimeFormat format strings. For more information, see <a>Class
--   DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the special value <tt>millis</tt>
--   to parse timestamps in epoch milliseconds. If you don't specify a
--   format, Kinesis Data Firehose uses
--   <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
[$sel:timestampFormats:HiveJsonSerDe'] :: HiveJsonSerDe -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>HiveJsonSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampFormats:HiveJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>hiveJsonSerDe_timestampFormats</a> - Indicates how you want Kinesis
--   Data Firehose to parse the date and timestamps that may be present in
--   your input data JSON. To specify these format strings, follow the
--   pattern syntax of JodaTime's DateTimeFormat format strings. For more
--   information, see <a>Class DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the
--   special value <tt>millis</tt> to parse timestamps in epoch
--   milliseconds. If you don't specify a format, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   uses <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
newHiveJsonSerDe :: HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Indicates how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to parse the date and
--   timestamps that may be present in your input data JSON. To specify
--   these format strings, follow the pattern syntax of JodaTime's
--   DateTimeFormat format strings. For more information, see <a>Class
--   DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the special value <tt>millis</tt>
--   to parse timestamps in epoch milliseconds. If you don't specify a
--   format, Kinesis Data Firehose uses
--   <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
hiveJsonSerDe_timestampFormats :: Lens' HiveJsonSerDe (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HiveJsonSerDe.HiveJsonSerDe


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the buffering options that can be applied before data is
--   delivered to the HTTP endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   treats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointBufferingHints
HttpEndpointBufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
[$sel:sizeInMBs:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'] :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5
--   minutes).
[$sel:intervalInSeconds:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'] :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointBufferingHints</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointBufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a> - Buffer incoming data to
--   the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination.
--   The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming
--   data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
newHttpEndpointBufferingHints :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
httpEndpointBufferingHints_sizeInMBs :: Lens' HttpEndpointBufferingHints (Maybe Natural)

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5
--   minutes).
httpEndpointBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds :: Lens' HttpEndpointBufferingHints (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointBufferingHints.HttpEndpointBufferingHints

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:HttpEndpointCommonAttribute'</a>,

--   HTTP endpoint common attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeValue:HttpEndpointCommonAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointCommonAttribute_attributeValue</a> - The value of the
--   HTTP endpoint common attribute.
newHttpEndpointCommonAttribute :: Text -> Text -> HttpEndpointCommonAttribute

-- | The value of the HTTP endpoint common attribute.

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint to which Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointConfiguration
HttpEndpointConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Sensitive Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration

-- | The name of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
[$sel:name:HttpEndpointConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The access key required for Kinesis Firehose to authenticate with the
--   HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
[$sel:accessKey:HttpEndpointConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The URL of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
--   
--   If you choose an HTTP endpoint as your destination, review and follow
--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.
[$sel:url:HttpEndpointConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:HttpEndpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointConfiguration_name</a> - The name of the HTTP endpoint
--   selected as the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKey:HttpEndpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointConfiguration_accessKey</a> - The access key required
--   for Kinesis Firehose to authenticate with the HTTP endpoint selected
--   as the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:HttpEndpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointConfiguration_url</a> - The URL of the HTTP endpoint
--   selected as the destination.
--   
--   If you choose an HTTP endpoint as your destination, review and follow
--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.
newHttpEndpointConfiguration :: Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration

-- | The name of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
httpEndpointConfiguration_name :: Lens' HttpEndpointConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The access key required for Kinesis Firehose to authenticate with the
--   HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
httpEndpointConfiguration_accessKey :: Lens' HttpEndpointConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
--   
--   If you choose an HTTP endpoint as your destination, review and follow
--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.
httpEndpointConfiguration_url :: Lens' HttpEndpointConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointConfiguration.HttpEndpointConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointConfiguration.HttpEndpointConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointConfiguration.HttpEndpointConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointConfiguration.HttpEndpointConfiguration

--   Firehose uses the content encoding to compress the body of a request

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointRetryOptions
HttpEndpointRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to the
--   custom destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the
--   periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment
--   from the specified destination after each attempt.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:HttpEndpointRetryOptions'] :: HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointRetryOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:HttpEndpointRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The total amount
--   of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries. This duration
--   starts after the initial attempt to send data to the custom
--   destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the periods
--   during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment from the
--   specified destination after each attempt.
newHttpEndpointRetryOptions :: HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to the
--   custom destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the
--   periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment
--   from the specified destination after each attempt.
httpEndpointRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' HttpEndpointRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointRetryOptions.HttpEndpointRetryOptions

--   Namespaces</a>.

--   <a>kmsEncryptionConfig_aWSKMSKeyARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to the same AWS Region as the
--   destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newKMSEncryptionConfig :: Text -> KMSEncryptionConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to
--   the same AWS Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType
newtype KeyType
KeyType' :: Text -> KeyType
[fromKeyType] :: KeyType -> Text
pattern KeyType_AWS_OWNED_CMK :: KeyType
pattern KeyType_CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK :: KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KeyType.KeyType


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput

-- | Specifies the type and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK to use
--   for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput
DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput' :: Maybe Text -> KeyType -> DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput

-- | If you set <tt>KeyType</tt> to <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, you must
--   specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. If you set
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> to <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose uses
--   a service-account CMK.
[$sel:keyARN:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput'] :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) to use for encryption.
--   The default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more information
--   about CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>. When you invoke
--   CreateDeliveryStream or StartDeliveryStreamEncryption with
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> set to CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   invokes the Amazon KMS operation <a>CreateGrant</a> to create a grant
--   that allows the Kinesis Data Firehose service to use the customer
--   managed CMK to perform encryption and decryption. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose manages that grant.
--   
--   When you invoke StartDeliveryStreamEncryption to change the CMK for a
--   delivery stream that is encrypted with a customer managed CMK, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose schedules the grant it had on the old CMK for
--   retirement.
--   
--   You can use a CMK of type CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK to encrypt up to 500
--   delivery streams. If a CreateDeliveryStream or
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption operation exceeds this limit, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose throws a <tt>LimitExceededException</tt>.
--   
--   To encrypt your delivery stream, use symmetric CMKs. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose doesn't support asymmetric CMKs. For information about
--   symmetric and asymmetric CMKs, see <a>About Symmetric and Asymmetric
--   CMKs</a> in the AWS Key Management Service developer guide.
[$sel:keyType:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput'] :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput -> KeyType

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyARN:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput_keyARN</a> - If you set
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> to <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, you must specify
--   the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. If you set <tt>KeyType</tt>
--   to <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose uses a
--   service-account CMK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyType:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput_keyType</a> - Indicates
--   the type of customer master key (CMK) to use for encryption. The
--   default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more information about
--   CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>. When you invoke
--   CreateDeliveryStream or StartDeliveryStreamEncryption with
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> set to CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   invokes the Amazon KMS operation <a>CreateGrant</a> to create a grant
--   that allows the Kinesis Data Firehose service to use the customer
--   managed CMK to perform encryption and decryption. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose manages that grant.
--   
--   When you invoke StartDeliveryStreamEncryption to change the CMK for a
--   delivery stream that is encrypted with a customer managed CMK, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose schedules the grant it had on the old CMK for
--   retirement.
--   
--   You can use a CMK of type CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK to encrypt up to 500
--   delivery streams. If a CreateDeliveryStream or
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption operation exceeds this limit, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose throws a <tt>LimitExceededException</tt>.
--   
--   To encrypt your delivery stream, use symmetric CMKs. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose doesn't support asymmetric CMKs. For information about
--   symmetric and asymmetric CMKs, see <a>About Symmetric and Asymmetric
--   CMKs</a> in the AWS Key Management Service developer guide.
newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput :: KeyType -> DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput

-- | If you set <tt>KeyType</tt> to <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, you must
--   specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. If you set
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> to <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose uses
--   a service-account CMK.
deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput_keyARN :: Lens' DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) to use for encryption.
--   The default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more information
--   about CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>. When you invoke
--   CreateDeliveryStream or StartDeliveryStreamEncryption with
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> set to CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   invokes the Amazon KMS operation <a>CreateGrant</a> to create a grant
--   that allows the Kinesis Data Firehose service to use the customer
--   managed CMK to perform encryption and decryption. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose manages that grant.
--   
--   When you invoke StartDeliveryStreamEncryption to change the CMK for a
--   delivery stream that is encrypted with a customer managed CMK, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose schedules the grant it had on the old CMK for
--   retirement.
--   
--   You can use a CMK of type CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK to encrypt up to 500
--   delivery streams. If a CreateDeliveryStream or
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption operation exceeds this limit, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose throws a <tt>LimitExceededException</tt>.
--   
--   To encrypt your delivery stream, use symmetric CMKs. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose doesn't support asymmetric CMKs. For information about
--   symmetric and asymmetric CMKs, see <a>About Symmetric and Asymmetric
--   CMKs</a> in the AWS Key Management Service developer guide.
deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput_keyType :: Lens' DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput KeyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration

-- | Contains information about the server-side encryption (SSE) status for
--   the delivery stream, the type customer master key (CMK) in use, if
--   any, and the ARN of the CMK. You can get
--   <tt>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</tt> by invoking the
--   DescribeDeliveryStream operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionStatus -> Maybe KeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FailureDescription -> DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration

-- | This is the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery
--   stream. For a full description of the different values of this status,
--   see StartDeliveryStreamEncryption and StopDeliveryStreamEncryption. If
--   this status is <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt> or <tt>DISABLING_FAILED</tt>,
--   it is the status of the most recent attempt to enable or disable SSE,
--   respectively.
[$sel:status:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'] :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionStatus

-- | Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) that is used for
--   encryption. The default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more
--   information about CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>.
[$sel:keyType:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'] :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe KeyType

-- | If <tt>KeyType</tt> is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, this field
--   contains the ARN of the customer managed CMK. If <tt>KeyType</tt> is
--   <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, <tt>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</tt>
--   doesn't contain a value for <tt>KeyARN</tt>.
[$sel:keyARN:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'] :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
[$sel:failureDescription:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'] :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe FailureDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_status</a> - This is the
--   server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery stream. For a
--   full description of the different values of this status, see
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption and StopDeliveryStreamEncryption. If
--   this status is <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt> or <tt>DISABLING_FAILED</tt>,
--   it is the status of the most recent attempt to enable or disable SSE,
--   respectively.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyType:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_keyType</a> - Indicates the
--   type of customer master key (CMK) that is used for encryption. The
--   default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more information about
--   CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyARN:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_keyARN</a> - If
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, this field contains
--   the ARN of the customer managed CMK. If <tt>KeyType</tt> is
--   <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, <tt>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</tt>
--   doesn't contain a value for <tt>KeyARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDescription:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_failureDescription</a> -
--   Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration

-- | This is the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery
--   stream. For a full description of the different values of this status,
--   see StartDeliveryStreamEncryption and StopDeliveryStreamEncryption. If
--   this status is <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt> or <tt>DISABLING_FAILED</tt>,
--   it is the status of the most recent attempt to enable or disable SSE,
--   respectively.
deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_status :: Lens' DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration (Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionStatus)

-- | Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) that is used for
--   encryption. The default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more
--   information about CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>.
deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_keyType :: Lens' DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration (Maybe KeyType)

-- | If <tt>KeyType</tt> is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, this field
--   contains the ARN of the customer managed CMK. If <tt>KeyType</tt> is
--   <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, <tt>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</tt>
--   doesn't contain a value for <tt>KeyARN</tt>.
deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_keyARN :: Lens' DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_failureDescription :: Lens' DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration (Maybe FailureDescription)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration.DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration

-- | The stream and role Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for a Kinesis data
--   stream used as the source for a delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisStreamSourceConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration
KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration' :: Text -> Text -> KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration

-- | The ARN of the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
[$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration'] :: KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration -> Text

-- | The ARN of the role that provides access to the source Kinesis data
--   stream. For more information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) ARN Format</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration'] :: KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceConfiguration_kinesisStreamARN</a> - The ARN of
--   the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The ARN of the role
--   that provides access to the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN
--   Format</a>.
newKinesisStreamSourceConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration

-- | The ARN of the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
kinesisStreamSourceConfiguration_kinesisStreamARN :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration Text

-- | The ARN of the role that provides access to the source Kinesis data
--   stream. For more information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) ARN Format</a>.
kinesisStreamSourceConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration.KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.KinesisStreamSourceDescription

-- | Details about a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisStreamSourceDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data KinesisStreamSourceDescription
KinesisStreamSourceDescription' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KinesisStreamSourceDescription

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data
--   stream starting with this timestamp.
[$sel:deliveryStartTimestamp:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'] :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For
--   more information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
[$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'] :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN
--   Format</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'] :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisStreamSourceDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStartTimestamp:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_deliveryStartTimestamp</a> - Kinesis
--   Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data stream
--   starting with this timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_kinesisStreamARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_roleARN</a> - The ARN of the role
--   used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see
--   <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN Format</a>.
newKinesisStreamSourceDescription :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data
--   stream starting with this timestamp.
kinesisStreamSourceDescription_deliveryStartTimestamp :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For
--   more information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
kinesisStreamSourceDescription_kinesisStreamARN :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN
--   Format</a>.
kinesisStreamSourceDescription_roleARN :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceDescription (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Describes the encryption for a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EncryptionConfiguration
EncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe NoEncryptionConfig -> Maybe KMSEncryptionConfig -> EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that
--   no encryption is used.
[$sel:noEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'] :: EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe NoEncryptionConfig

-- | The encryption key.
[$sel:kmsEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'] :: EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe KMSEncryptionConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>EncryptionConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfiguration_noEncryptionConfig</a> - Specifically
--   override existing encryption information to ensure that no encryption
--   is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfiguration_kmsEncryptionConfig</a> - The encryption
--   key.
newEncryptionConfiguration :: EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that
--   no encryption is used.
encryptionConfiguration_noEncryptionConfig :: Lens' EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe NoEncryptionConfig)

-- | The encryption key.
encryptionConfiguration_kmsEncryptionConfig :: Lens' EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe KMSEncryptionConfig)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe

-- | The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data,
--   which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for
--   serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two
--   deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the
--   functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog
--   JsonSerDe.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOpenXJsonSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data OpenXJsonSerDe
OpenXJsonSerDe' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> OpenXJsonSerDe

-- | Maps column names to JSON keys that aren't identical to the column
--   names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive
--   keywords. For example, <tt>timestamp</tt> is a Hive keyword. If you
--   have a JSON key named <tt>timestamp</tt>, set this parameter to
--   <tt>{"ts": "timestamp"}</tt> to map this key to a column named
--   <tt>ts</tt>.
[$sel:columnToJsonKeyMappings:OpenXJsonSerDe'] :: OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.
[$sel:caseInsensitive:OpenXJsonSerDe'] :: OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, specifies that the names of the keys
--   include dots and that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them
--   with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow
--   dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose
--   name is "a.b", you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using
--   this option.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores:OpenXJsonSerDe'] :: OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>OpenXJsonSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnToJsonKeyMappings:OpenXJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>openXJsonSerDe_columnToJsonKeyMappings</a> - Maps column names to
--   JSON keys that aren't identical to the column names. This is useful
--   when the JSON contains keys that are Hive keywords. For example,
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> is a Hive keyword. If you have a JSON key named
--   <tt>timestamp</tt>, set this parameter to <tt>{"ts": "timestamp"}</tt>
--   to map this key to a column named <tt>ts</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseInsensitive:OpenXJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>openXJsonSerDe_caseInsensitive</a> - When set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose converts JSON keys to
--   lowercase before deserializing them.
--   
--   <a>$sel:convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores:OpenXJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>openXJsonSerDe_convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, specifies that the names of the keys include dots and
--   that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them with underscores.
--   This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow dots in column
--   names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose name is "a.b",
--   you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using this option.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
newOpenXJsonSerDe :: OpenXJsonSerDe

-- | Maps column names to JSON keys that aren't identical to the column
--   names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive
--   keywords. For example, <tt>timestamp</tt> is a Hive keyword. If you
--   have a JSON key named <tt>timestamp</tt>, set this parameter to
--   <tt>{"ts": "timestamp"}</tt> to map this key to a column named
--   <tt>ts</tt>.
openXJsonSerDe_columnToJsonKeyMappings :: Lens' OpenXJsonSerDe (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.
openXJsonSerDe_caseInsensitive :: Lens' OpenXJsonSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, specifies that the names of the keys
--   include dots and that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them
--   with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow
--   dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose
--   name is "a.b", you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using
--   this option.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
openXJsonSerDe_convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores :: Lens' OpenXJsonSerDe (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OpenXJsonSerDe.OpenXJsonSerDe


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer

-- | The deserializer you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use for converting
--   the input data from JSON. Kinesis Data Firehose then serializes the
--   data to its final format using the Serializer. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   supports two types of deserializers: the <a>Apache Hive JSON SerDe</a>
--   and the <a>OpenX JSON SerDe</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeserializer</a> smart constructor.
data Deserializer
Deserializer' :: Maybe OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe HiveJsonSerDe -> Deserializer

-- | The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data,
--   which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for
--   serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two
--   deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the
--   functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog
--   JsonSerDe.
[$sel:openXJsonSerDe:Deserializer'] :: Deserializer -> Maybe OpenXJsonSerDe

-- | The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose
--   for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format
--   in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one
--   offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX
--   SerDe.
[$sel:hiveJsonSerDe:Deserializer'] :: Deserializer -> Maybe HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Create a value of <a>Deserializer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openXJsonSerDe:Deserializer'</a>,
--   <a>deserializer_openXJsonSerDe</a> - The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis
--   Data Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from
--   the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or
--   ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending
--   on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is
--   the native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hiveJsonSerDe:Deserializer'</a>,
--   <a>deserializer_hiveJsonSerDe</a> - The native Hive / HCatalog
--   JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data, which
--   means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for
--   serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two
--   deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the
--   functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX SerDe.
newDeserializer :: Deserializer

-- | The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data,
--   which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for
--   serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two
--   deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the
--   functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog
--   JsonSerDe.
deserializer_openXJsonSerDe :: Lens' Deserializer (Maybe OpenXJsonSerDe)

-- | The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose
--   for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format
--   in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one
--   offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX
--   SerDe.
deserializer_hiveJsonSerDe :: Lens' Deserializer (Maybe HiveJsonSerDe)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Deserializer.Deserializer


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies the deserializer you want to use to convert the format of
--   the input data. This parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set
--   to true.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputFormatConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data InputFormatConfiguration
InputFormatConfiguration' :: Maybe Deserializer -> InputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache
--   Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the
--   server rejects the request.
[$sel:deserializer:InputFormatConfiguration'] :: InputFormatConfiguration -> Maybe Deserializer

-- | Create a value of <a>InputFormatConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deserializer:InputFormatConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inputFormatConfiguration_deserializer</a> - Specifies which
--   deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache Hive JSON SerDe
--   or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
newInputFormatConfiguration :: InputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache
--   Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the
--   server rejects the request.
inputFormatConfiguration_deserializer :: Lens' InputFormatConfiguration (Maybe Deserializer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.InputFormatConfiguration.InputFormatConfiguration

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrcSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data OrcSerDe
OrcSerDe' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe OrcCompression -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe OrcFormatVersion -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Double -> OrcSerDe

-- | The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP,
--   the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is
--   0, and the maximum is 1.
[$sel:bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Double

-- | Represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn
--   off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less
--   than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use
--   dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.
[$sel:dictionaryKeyThreshold:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Double

-- | Set this to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that you want stripes to be
--   padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to
--   copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:enablePadding:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is
--   <tt>SNAPPY</tt>.
[$sel:compression:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe OrcCompression

-- | The column names for which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to create
--   bloom filters. The default is <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:bloomFilterColumns:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and
--   the minimum is 1,000.
[$sel:rowIndexStride:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | The version of the file to write. The possible values are
--   <tt>V0_11</tt> and <tt>V0_12</tt>. The default is <tt>V0_12</tt>.
[$sel:formatVersion:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe OrcFormatVersion

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
[$sel:blockSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the
--   minimum is 8 MiB.
[$sel:stripeSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | A number between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding
--   as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which
--   means 5 percent of stripe size.
--   
--   For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks,
--   the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of
--   3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the
--   available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller
--   stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no
--   stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a
--   node-local task.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when
--   OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:paddingTolerance:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>OrcSerDe</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability</a> - The Bloom filter
--   false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP, the bigger the
--   Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is 0, and the
--   maximum is 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dictionaryKeyThreshold:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_dictionaryKeyThreshold</a> - Represents the fraction of
--   the total number of non-null rows. To turn off dictionary encoding,
--   set this fraction to a number that is less than the number of distinct
--   keys in a dictionary. To always use dictionary encoding, set this
--   threshold to 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enablePadding:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_enablePadding</a> -
--   Set this to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that you want stripes to be
--   padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to
--   copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compression:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_compression</a> - The
--   compression code to use over data blocks. The default is
--   <tt>SNAPPY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bloomFilterColumns:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_bloomFilterColumns</a> - The column names for which you
--   want Kinesis Data Firehose to create bloom filters. The default is
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rowIndexStride:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_rowIndexStride</a> -
--   The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and
--   the minimum is 1,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formatVersion:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_formatVersion</a> -
--   The version of the file to write. The possible values are
--   <tt>V0_11</tt> and <tt>V0_12</tt>. The default is <tt>V0_12</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_blockSizeBytes</a> -
--   The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stripeSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_stripeSizeBytes</a>
--   - The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the
--   minimum is 8 MiB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:paddingTolerance:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_paddingTolerance</a> - A number between 0 and 1 that
--   defines the tolerance for block padding as a decimal fraction of
--   stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which means 5 percent of
--   stripe size.
--   
--   For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks,
--   the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of
--   3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the
--   available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller
--   stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no
--   stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a
--   node-local task.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when
--   OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is <tt>false</tt>.
newOrcSerDe :: OrcSerDe

-- | The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP,
--   the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is
--   0, and the maximum is 1.
orcSerDe_bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Double)

-- | Represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn
--   off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less
--   than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use
--   dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.
orcSerDe_dictionaryKeyThreshold :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Double)

-- | Set this to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that you want stripes to be
--   padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to
--   copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
orcSerDe_enablePadding :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is
--   <tt>SNAPPY</tt>.
orcSerDe_compression :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe OrcCompression)

-- | The column names for which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to create
--   bloom filters. The default is <tt>null</tt>.
orcSerDe_bloomFilterColumns :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe [Text])

-- | The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and
--   the minimum is 1,000.
orcSerDe_rowIndexStride :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | The version of the file to write. The possible values are
--   <tt>V0_11</tt> and <tt>V0_12</tt>. The default is <tt>V0_12</tt>.
orcSerDe_formatVersion :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe OrcFormatVersion)

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
orcSerDe_blockSizeBytes :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the
--   minimum is 8 MiB.
orcSerDe_stripeSizeBytes :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | A number between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding
--   as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which
--   means 5 percent of stripe size.
--   
--   For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks,
--   the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of
--   3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the
--   available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller
--   stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no
--   stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a
--   node-local task.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when
--   OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is <tt>false</tt>.
orcSerDe_paddingTolerance :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OrcSerDe.OrcSerDe
