module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParquetSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data ParquetSerDe
ParquetSerDe' :: Maybe ParquetWriterVersion -> Maybe ParquetCompression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> ParquetSerDe

-- | Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are
--   <tt>V1</tt> and <tt>V2</tt>. The default is <tt>V1</tt>.
[$sel:writerVersion:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe ParquetWriterVersion

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>, <tt>SNAPPY</tt>, and <tt>GZIP</tt>, with the
--   default being <tt>SNAPPY</tt>. Use <tt>SNAPPY</tt> for higher
--   decompression speed. Use <tt>GZIP</tt> if the compression ratio is
--   more important than speed.
[$sel:compression:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe ParquetCompression

-- | The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend
--   to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default
--   is 0.
[$sel:maxPaddingBytes:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether to enable dictionary compression.
[$sel:enableDictionaryCompression:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is
--   conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and
--   encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.
[$sel:pageSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
[$sel:blockSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ParquetSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:writerVersion:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_writerVersion</a> - Indicates the version of row
--   format to output. The possible values are <tt>V1</tt> and <tt>V2</tt>.
--   The default is <tt>V1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compression:ParquetSerDe'</a>, <a>parquetSerDe_compression</a>
--   - The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values
--   are <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>, <tt>SNAPPY</tt>, and <tt>GZIP</tt>, with
--   the default being <tt>SNAPPY</tt>. Use <tt>SNAPPY</tt> for higher
--   decompression speed. Use <tt>GZIP</tt> if the compression ratio is
--   more important than speed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxPaddingBytes:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_maxPaddingBytes</a> - The maximum amount of padding to
--   apply. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to
--   HDFS before querying. The default is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableDictionaryCompression:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_enableDictionaryCompression</a> - Indicates whether to
--   enable dictionary compression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_pageSizeBytes</a> - The Parquet page size. Column
--   chunks are divided into pages. A page is conceptually an indivisible
--   unit (in terms of compression and encoding). The minimum value is 64
--   KiB and the default is 1 MiB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_blockSizeBytes</a> - The Hadoop Distributed File
--   System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the
--   data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB
--   and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data Firehose uses this value for
--   padding calculations.
newParquetSerDe :: ParquetSerDe

-- | Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are
--   <tt>V1</tt> and <tt>V2</tt>. The default is <tt>V1</tt>.
parquetSerDe_writerVersion :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe ParquetWriterVersion)

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>, <tt>SNAPPY</tt>, and <tt>GZIP</tt>, with the
--   default being <tt>SNAPPY</tt>. Use <tt>SNAPPY</tt> for higher
--   decompression speed. Use <tt>GZIP</tt> if the compression ratio is
--   more important than speed.
parquetSerDe_compression :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe ParquetCompression)

-- | The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend
--   to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default
--   is 0.
parquetSerDe_maxPaddingBytes :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether to enable dictionary compression.
parquetSerDe_enableDictionaryCompression :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is
--   conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and
--   encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.
parquetSerDe_pageSizeBytes :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
parquetSerDe_blockSizeBytes :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ParquetSerDe.ParquetSerDe

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Processor

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   processor parameters.

--   processor.

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry

-- | Contains the result for an individual record from a PutRecordBatch
--   request. If the record is successfully added to your delivery stream,
--   it receives a record ID. If the record fails to be added to your
--   delivery stream, the result includes an error code and an error
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecordBatchResponseEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
PutRecordBatchResponseEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PutRecordBatchResponseEntry

-- | The ID of the record.
[$sel:recordId:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'] :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The error code for an individual record result.
[$sel:errorCode:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'] :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The error message for an individual record result.
[$sel:errorMessage:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'] :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutRecordBatchResponseEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordId:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponseEntry_recordId</a> - The ID of the record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponseEntry_errorCode</a> - The error code for an
--   individual record result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponseEntry_errorMessage</a> - The error message
--   for an individual record result.
newPutRecordBatchResponseEntry :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry

-- | The ID of the record.
putRecordBatchResponseEntry_recordId :: Lens' PutRecordBatchResponseEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The error code for an individual record result.
putRecordBatchResponseEntry_errorCode :: Lens' PutRecordBatchResponseEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The error message for an individual record result.
putRecordBatchResponseEntry_errorMessage :: Lens' PutRecordBatchResponseEntry (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry.PutRecordBatchResponseEntry


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record

-- | The unit of data in a delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Base64 -> Record

-- | The data blob, which is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized.
--   The maximum size of the data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000
--   KiB.
[$sel:data':Record'] :: Record -> Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Record'</a>, <a>record_data</a> - The data blob, which
--   is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized. The maximum size of the
--   data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000 KiB.-- -- <i>Note:</i>
--   This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. --
--   The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during
--   -- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
newRecord :: ByteString -> Record

-- | The data blob, which is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized.
--   The maximum size of the data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000
--   KiB.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
record_data :: Lens' Record ByteString
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Record.Record


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedshiftRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data RedshiftRetryOptions
RedshiftRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The length of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery
--   after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the
--   first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis
--   Data Firehose does not retry if the value of
--   <tt>DurationInSeconds</tt> is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery
--   attempt takes longer than the current value.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:RedshiftRetryOptions'] :: RedshiftRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RedshiftRetryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:RedshiftRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The length of time
--   during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery after a failure,
--   starting from the initial request and including the first attempt. The
--   default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis Data Firehose does
--   not retry if the value of <tt>DurationInSeconds</tt> is 0 (zero) or if
--   the first delivery attempt takes longer than the current value.
newRedshiftRetryOptions :: RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The length of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery
--   after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the
--   first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis
--   Data Firehose does not retry if the value of
--   <tt>DurationInSeconds</tt> is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery
--   attempt takes longer than the current value.
redshiftRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' RedshiftRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftRetryOptions.RedshiftRetryOptions

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RetryOptions

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to an Amazon S3 prefix.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data RetryOptions
RetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> RetryOptions

-- | The period of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to
--   deliver data to the specified Amazon S3 prefix.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:RetryOptions'] :: RetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>retryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The period of time during
--   which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to deliver data to the specified
--   Amazon S3 prefix.
newRetryOptions :: RetryOptions

-- | The period of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to
--   deliver data to the specified Amazon S3 prefix.
retryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' RetryOptions (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RetryOptions.RetryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RetryOptions.RetryOptions

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamicPartitioningConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
DynamicPartitioningConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe RetryOptions -> DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | Specifies that the dynamic partitioning is enabled for this Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream.
[$sel:enabled:DynamicPartitioningConfiguration'] :: DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to an Amazon S3 prefix.
[$sel:retryOptions:DynamicPartitioningConfiguration'] :: DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe RetryOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamicPartitioningConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:DynamicPartitioningConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dynamicPartitioningConfiguration_enabled</a> - Specifies that the
--   dynamic partitioning is enabled for this Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:DynamicPartitioningConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dynamicPartitioningConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to an
--   Amazon S3 prefix.
newDynamicPartitioningConfiguration :: DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | Specifies that the dynamic partitioning is enabled for this Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream.
dynamicPartitioningConfiguration_enabled :: Lens' DynamicPartitioningConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to an Amazon S3 prefix.
dynamicPartitioningConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' DynamicPartitioningConfiguration (Maybe RetryOptions)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration.DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3DestinationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data S3DestinationConfiguration
S3DestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads
--   from the S3 bucket.
[$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
[$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3DestinationConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_prefix</a> - The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time
--   format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You
--   can also specify a custom prefix, as described in <a>Custom Prefixes
--   for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix that
--   Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before
--   writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the
--   bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see
--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The
--   encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no
--   encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_compressionFormat</a> - The compression
--   format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads
--   from the S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering
--   option. If no value is specified, <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object
--   default values are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationConfiguration_bucketARN</a> - The ARN of the S3
--   bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and
--   AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newS3DestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
s3DestinationConfiguration_prefix :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
s3DestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
s3DestinationConfiguration_errorOutputPrefix :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
s3DestinationConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration (Maybe EncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads
--   from the S3 bucket.
s3DestinationConfiguration_compressionFormat :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration (Maybe CompressionFormat)

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
s3DestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration (Maybe BufferingHints)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
s3DestinationConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
s3DestinationConfiguration_bucketARN :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationConfiguration.S3DestinationConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedshiftDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
RedshiftDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> Text -> CopyCommand -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> RedshiftDestinationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can
--   update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is
--   enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3BackupConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).
[$sel:retryOptions:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The database connection string.
[$sel:clusterJDBCURL:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The <tt>COPY</tt> command.
[$sel:copyCommand:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> CopyCommand

-- | The name of the user.
[$sel:username:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Sensitive Text

-- | The user password.
[$sel:password:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Sensitive Text

-- | The configuration for the intermediate Amazon S3 location from which
--   Amazon Redshift obtains data. Restrictions are described in the topic
--   for CreateDeliveryStream.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.S3Configuration</tt>
--   because the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads from
--   the S3 bucket doesn't support these compression formats.
[$sel:s3Configuration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>RedshiftDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - The Amazon S3
--   backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can update it to
--   enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is enabled, you
--   can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents
--   to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> - The
--   data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterJDBCURL:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_clusterJDBCURL</a> - The database
--   connection string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyCommand:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_copyCommand</a> - The
--   <tt>COPY</tt> command.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_username</a> - The name of the
--   user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_password</a> - The user password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> - The
--   configuration for the intermediate Amazon S3 location from which
--   Amazon Redshift obtains data. Restrictions are described in the topic
--   for CreateDeliveryStream.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.S3Configuration</tt>
--   because the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads from
--   the S3 bucket doesn't support these compression formats.
newRedshiftDestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> CopyCommand -> Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> RedshiftDestinationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can
--   update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is
--   enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration (Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode)

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupConfiguration :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration (Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration (Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The database connection string.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_clusterJDBCURL :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The <tt>COPY</tt> command.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_copyCommand :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration CopyCommand

-- | The name of the user.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_username :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The user password.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_password :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The configuration for the intermediate Amazon S3 location from which
--   Amazon Redshift obtains data. Restrictions are described in the topic
--   for CreateDeliveryStream.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.S3Configuration</tt>
--   because the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads from
--   the S3 bucket doesn't support these compression formats.
redshiftDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationConfiguration S3DestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.RedshiftDestinationConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration
HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
[$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
[$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions
[$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the requeste sent to the HTTP endpoint specified
--   as the destination.
[$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
[$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
[$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointConfiguration
[$sel:s3Configuration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - Describes
--   the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up all
--   documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint destination
--   (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - Describes
--   the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it doesn't
--   receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified HTTP
--   endpoint destination.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_requestConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration of the requeste sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that the delivery
--   stream needs.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_endpointConfiguration</a> -
--   The configuration of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newHttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints)

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions)

-- | Undocumented member.

--   as the destination.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_requestConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration)

--   the delivery stream needs.

httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_endpointConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration HttpEndpointConfiguration

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration S3DestinationConfiguration

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription

-- | Describes a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3DestinationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data S3DestinationDescription
S3DestinationDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> BufferingHints -> CompressionFormat -> EncryptionConfiguration -> S3DestinationDescription

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> Text

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
[$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> BufferingHints

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
[$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> CompressionFormat

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationDescription'] :: S3DestinationDescription -> EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>S3DestinationDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_prefix</a> - The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time
--   format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You
--   can also specify a custom prefix, as described in <a>Custom Prefixes
--   for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The Amazon
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix that
--   Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before
--   writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the
--   bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see
--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_bucketARN</a> - The ARN of the S3 bucket.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS
--   Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering option.
--   If no value is specified, <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default
--   values are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_compressionFormat</a> - The compression
--   format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationDescription_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The
--   encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no
--   encryption.
newS3DestinationDescription :: Text -> Text -> BufferingHints -> CompressionFormat -> EncryptionConfiguration -> S3DestinationDescription

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
s3DestinationDescription_prefix :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
s3DestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
s3DestinationDescription_errorOutputPrefix :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
s3DestinationDescription_roleARN :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
s3DestinationDescription_bucketARN :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription Text

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
s3DestinationDescription_bufferingHints :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription BufferingHints

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
s3DestinationDescription_compressionFormat :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription CompressionFormat

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
s3DestinationDescription_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' S3DestinationDescription EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationDescription.S3DestinationDescription

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationDescription

-- | Describes the HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointDestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HttpEndpointDestinationDescription
HttpEndpointDestinationDescription' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointDestinationDescription

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
[$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it
--   is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
[$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | The configuration of the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointDescription
[$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The configuration of request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
[$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
[$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_s3BackupMode</a> - Describes the
--   S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Firehose delivers
--   to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up all documents
--   (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis Data Firehose
--   could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint destination
--   (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3DestinationDescription:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_s3DestinationDescription</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_bufferingHints</a> - Describes
--   buffering options that can be applied to the data before it is
--   delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_retryOptions</a> - Describes the
--   retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data
--   to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it doesn't receive a
--   valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_endpointConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration of the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_requestConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration of request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as the
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_roleARN</a> - Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that the delivery
--   stream needs.
newHttpEndpointDestinationDescription :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_s3BackupMode :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_s3DestinationDescription :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe S3DestinationDescription)

-- | Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it
--   is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_bufferingHints :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints)

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_retryOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions)

-- | The configuration of the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_endpointConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe HttpEndpointDescription)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_processingConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The configuration of request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_requestConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration)

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
httpEndpointDestinationDescription_roleARN :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.S3DestinationUpdate

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3DestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data S3DestinationUpdate
S3DestinationUpdate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads
--   from the S3 bucket.
[$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
[$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationUpdate'] :: S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3DestinationUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_prefix</a> - The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format
--   prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can
--   also specify a custom prefix, as described in <a>Custom Prefixes for
--   Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The CloudWatch
--   logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them
--   to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For
--   information about how to specify this prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes
--   for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The encryption
--   configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_compressionFormat</a> - The compression format.
--   If no value is specified, the default is <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads
--   from the S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering option. If
--   no value is specified, <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values
--   are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_bucketARN</a> - The ARN of the S3 bucket. For
--   more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>s3DestinationUpdate_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newS3DestinationUpdate :: S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
s3DestinationUpdate_prefix :: Lens' S3DestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
s3DestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' S3DestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
s3DestinationUpdate_errorOutputPrefix :: Lens' S3DestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
s3DestinationUpdate_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' S3DestinationUpdate (Maybe EncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--

--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.

--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.

--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
s3DestinationUpdate_roleARN :: Lens' S3DestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.RedshiftDestinationUpdate

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedshiftDestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data RedshiftDestinationUpdate
RedshiftDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CopyCommand -> Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RedshiftDestinationUpdate

-- | You can update a delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is
--   disabled. If backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream
--   to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The name of the user.
[$sel:username:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationUpdate.S3Update</tt> because the
--   Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads from the S3 bucket
--   doesn't support these compression formats.
[$sel:s3Update:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The user password.
[$sel:password:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 destination for backup.
[$sel:s3BackupUpdate:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The <tt>COPY</tt> command.
[$sel:copyCommand:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CopyCommand

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).
[$sel:retryOptions:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The database connection string.
[$sel:clusterJDBCURL:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'] :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RedshiftDestinationUpdate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode</a> - You can update a
--   delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If
--   backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:RedshiftDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The Amazon
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

--   <a>redshiftDestinationUpdate_username</a> - The name of the user.

--   <a>redshiftDestinationUpdate_s3Update</a> - The Amazon S3 destination.

--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationUpdate.S3Update</tt> because the

--   <a>redshiftDestinationUpdate_s3BackupUpdate</a> - The Amazon S3
--   destination for backup.

--   command.

--   (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newRedshiftDestinationUpdate :: RedshiftDestinationUpdate

--   disabled. If backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream
--   to disable it.

redshiftDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The name of the user.
redshiftDestinationUpdate_username :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.

--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationUpdate.S3Update</tt> because the

redshiftDestinationUpdate_s3Update :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationUpdate (Maybe S3DestinationUpdate)

redshiftDestinationUpdate_password :: Lens' RedshiftDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)
