module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate

-- | Updates the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointDestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
[$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions
[$sel:s3Update:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it
--   is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
[$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointConfiguration
[$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified
--   as the destination.
[$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
[$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode</a> - Describes the S3
--   bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Firehose delivers to
--   the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up all documents
--   (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis Data Firehose
--   could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint destination
--   (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Update:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_s3Update</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_bufferingHints</a> - Describes
--   buffering options that can be applied to the data before it is
--   delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_retryOptions</a> - Describes the
--   retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data
--   to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it doesn't receive a
--   valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_endpointConfiguration</a> - Describes
--   the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_requestConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration of the request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_roleARN</a> - Kinesis Data Firehose
--   uses this IAM role for all the permissions that the delivery stream
--   needs.
newHttpEndpointDestinationUpdate :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_s3Update :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe S3DestinationUpdate)

-- | Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it
--   is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_bufferingHints :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints)

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_retryOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions)

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_endpointConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe HttpEndpointConfiguration)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The configuration of the request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified
--   as the destination.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_requestConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration)

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
httpEndpointDestinationUpdate_roleARN :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate.HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchDestinationUpdate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate
ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate

-- | The Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of old
--   data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
[$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod

-- | The Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only
--   one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing
--   index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an
--   error during runtime.
--   
--   If you upgrade Elasticsearch from 6.x to 7.x and don’t update your
--   delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose still delivers data to
--   Elasticsearch with the old index name and type name. If you want to
--   update your delivery stream with a new index name, provide an empty
--   string for <tt>TypeName</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions
--   for <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the IAM role
--   specified in <tt>RoleARN</tt>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
[$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.
[$sel:s3Update:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The buffering options. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
[$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by
--   Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and
--   for indexing documents. For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis
--   Data Firehose Access to an Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify
--   either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
[$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Elasticsearch index name.
[$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexRotationPeriod</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of old
--   data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_typeName</a> - The Elasticsearch
--   type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one type per
--   index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index that
--   already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error
--   during runtime.
--   
--   If you upgrade Elasticsearch from 6.x to 7.x and don’t update your
--   delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose still delivers data to
--   Elasticsearch with the old index name and type name. If you want to
--   update your delivery stream with a new index name, provide an empty
--   string for <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_domainARN</a> - The ARN of the
--   Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions for
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the IAM role
--   specified in <tt>RoleARN</tt>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Update:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_s3Update</a> - The Amazon S3
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering
--   options. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents
--   to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration</a> - The
--   data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data Firehose for
--   calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and for indexing documents.
--   For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis Data Firehose Access to an
--   Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS
--   Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_clusterEndpoint</a> - The endpoint
--   to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify either this
--   <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexName</a> - The Elasticsearch
--   index name.
newElasticsearchDestinationUpdate :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate

-- | The Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of old
--   data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexRotationPeriod :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod)

-- | The Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only
--   one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing
--   index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an
--   error during runtime.
--   
--   If you upgrade Elasticsearch from 6.x to 7.x and don’t update your
--   delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose still delivers data to
--   Elasticsearch with the old index name and type name. If you want to
--   update your delivery stream with a new index name, provide an empty
--   string for <tt>TypeName</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_typeName :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions
--   for <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the IAM role
--   specified in <tt>RoleARN</tt>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_domainARN :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_s3Update :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe S3DestinationUpdate)

-- | The buffering options. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_bufferingHints :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_retryOptions :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by
--   Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and
--   for indexing documents. For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis
--   Data Firehose Access to an Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_roleARN :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify
--   either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_clusterEndpoint :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexName :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration

-- | Specifies the schema to which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   configure your data before it writes it to Amazon S3. This parameter
--   is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSchemaConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SchemaConfiguration
SchemaConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SchemaConfiguration

-- | Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don't
--   specify this version ID, or if you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any
--   updates to the table are automatically picked up.
[$sel:versionId:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the AWS Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS
--   account ID is used by default.
[$sel:catalogId:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the AWS Glue database that contains the schema
--   for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
[$sel:databaseName:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | If you don't specify an AWS Region, the default is the current Region.
[$sel:region:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue table that contains the column information that
--   constitutes your data schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
[$sel:tableName:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This
--   role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   Cross-account roles aren't allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
[$sel:roleARN:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SchemaConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_versionId</a> - Specifies the table version for
--   the output data schema. If you don't specify this version ID, or if
--   you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose uses the most
--   recent version. This means that any updates to the table are
--   automatically picked up.
--   
--   <a>$sel:catalogId:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_catalogId</a> - The ID of the AWS Glue Data
--   Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS account ID is used by
--   default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_databaseName</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   AWS Glue database that contains the schema for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_region</a> - If you don't specify an AWS
--   Region, the default is the current Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_tableName</a> - Specifies the AWS Glue table
--   that contains the column information that constitutes your data
--   schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The role that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This role must be in the same
--   account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose. Cross-account roles aren't
--   allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
newSchemaConfiguration :: SchemaConfiguration

-- | Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don't
--   specify this version ID, or if you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any
--   updates to the table are automatically picked up.
schemaConfiguration_versionId :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the AWS Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS
--   account ID is used by default.
schemaConfiguration_catalogId :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the AWS Glue database that contains the schema
--   for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
schemaConfiguration_databaseName :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | If you don't specify an AWS Region, the default is the current Region.
schemaConfiguration_region :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue table that contains the column information that
--   constitutes your data schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
schemaConfiguration_tableName :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This
--   role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   Cross-account roles aren't allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
schemaConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SchemaConfiguration.SchemaConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer

-- | The serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert
--   data to the target format before writing it to Amazon S3. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose supports two types of serializers: the <a>ORC SerDe</a> and
--   the <a>Parquet SerDe</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSerializer</a> smart constructor.
data Serializer
Serializer' :: Maybe OrcSerDe -> Maybe ParquetSerDe -> Serializer

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
[$sel:orcSerDe:Serializer'] :: Serializer -> Maybe OrcSerDe

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
[$sel:parquetSerDe:Serializer'] :: Serializer -> Maybe ParquetSerDe

-- | Create a value of <a>Serializer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:orcSerDe:Serializer'</a>, <a>serializer_orcSerDe</a> - A
--   serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before storing
--   it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parquetSerDe:Serializer'</a>, <a>serializer_parquetSerDe</a> -
--   A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
newSerializer :: Serializer

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
serializer_orcSerDe :: Lens' Serializer (Maybe OrcSerDe)

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
serializer_parquetSerDe :: Lens' Serializer (Maybe ParquetSerDe)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Serializer.Serializer


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   convert the format of your data before it writes it to Amazon S3. This
--   parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputFormatConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data OutputFormatConfiguration
OutputFormatConfiguration' :: Maybe Serializer -> OutputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe
--   or the Parquet SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
[$sel:serializer:OutputFormatConfiguration'] :: OutputFormatConfiguration -> Maybe Serializer

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputFormatConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serializer:OutputFormatConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>outputFormatConfiguration_serializer</a> - Specifies which
--   serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe or the Parquet
--   SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the request.
newOutputFormatConfiguration :: OutputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe
--   or the Parquet SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
outputFormatConfiguration_serializer :: Lens' OutputFormatConfiguration (Maybe Serializer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.OutputFormatConfiguration.OutputFormatConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | Specifies that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to convert data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3. Kinesis Data Firehose uses the serializer and deserializer that
--   you specify, in addition to the column information from the AWS Glue
--   table, to deserialize your input data from JSON and then serialize it
--   to the Parquet or ORC format. For more information, see <a>Kinesis
--   Data Firehose Record Format Conversion</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataFormatConversionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DataFormatConversionConfiguration
DataFormatConversionConfiguration' :: Maybe OutputFormatConfiguration -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe InputFormatConfiguration -> DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
[$sel:outputFormatConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'] :: DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe OutputFormatConfiguration

-- | Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. Set it to <tt>false</tt> if you want to
--   disable format conversion while preserving the configuration details.
[$sel:enabled:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'] :: DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column
--   information. This parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to
--   true.
[$sel:schemaConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'] :: DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe SchemaConfiguration

-- | Specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use
--   to convert the format of your data from JSON. This parameter is
--   required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
[$sel:inputFormatConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'] :: DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe InputFormatConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>DataFormatConversionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputFormatConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_outputFormatConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_enabled</a> - Defaults to
--   <tt>true</tt>. Set it to <tt>false</tt> if you want to disable format
--   conversion while preserving the configuration details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_schemaConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies the AWS Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column
--   information. This parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to
--   true.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFormatConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_inputFormatConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use
--   to convert the format of your data from JSON. This parameter is
--   required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
newDataFormatConversionConfiguration :: DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
dataFormatConversionConfiguration_outputFormatConfiguration :: Lens' DataFormatConversionConfiguration (Maybe OutputFormatConfiguration)

-- | Defaults to <tt>true</tt>. Set it to <tt>false</tt> if you want to
--   disable format conversion while preserving the configuration details.
dataFormatConversionConfiguration_enabled :: Lens' DataFormatConversionConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column
--   information. This parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to
--   true.
dataFormatConversionConfiguration_schemaConfiguration :: Lens' DataFormatConversionConfiguration (Maybe SchemaConfiguration)

-- | Specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use
--   to convert the format of your data from JSON. This parameter is
--   required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
dataFormatConversionConfiguration_inputFormatConfiguration :: Lens' DataFormatConversionConfiguration (Maybe InputFormatConfiguration)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DataFormatConversionConfiguration.DataFormatConversionConfiguration


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExtendedS3DestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate
ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate' :: Maybe S3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate

-- | You can update a delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is
--   disabled. If backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream
--   to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3BackupMode

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 destination for backup.
[$sel:s3BackupUpdate:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
[$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
[$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
[$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode</a> - You can update a
--   delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If
--   backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_prefix</a> - The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time
--   format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You
--   can also specify a custom prefix, as described in <a>Custom Prefixes
--   for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix that
--   Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before
--   writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the
--   bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see
--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupUpdate:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_s3BackupUpdate</a> - The Amazon S3
--   destination for backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The
--   encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no
--   encryption.
--   
--

--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--

--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering
--   option.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_dataFormatConversionConfiguration</a> -
--   The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_bucketARN</a> - The ARN of the S3
--   bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and
--   AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration</a> - The data
--   processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationUpdate_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newExtendedS3DestinationUpdate :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate

-- | You can update a delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is
--   disabled. If backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream
--   to disable it.
extendedS3DestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate (Maybe S3BackupMode)

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
extendedS3DestinationUpdate_prefix :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
extendedS3DestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
extendedS3DestinationUpdate_errorOutputPrefix :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 destination for backup.

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
extendedS3DestinationUpdate_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate (Maybe EncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for

extendedS3DestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ExtendedS3DestinationDescription

-- | Describes a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExtendedS3DestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ExtendedS3DestinationDescription
ExtendedS3DestinationDescription' :: Maybe S3BackupMode -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> Text -> BufferingHints -> CompressionFormat -> EncryptionConfiguration -> ExtendedS3DestinationDescription

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe S3BackupMode

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3BackupDescription:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
[$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
[$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Text

-- | The buffering option.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> BufferingHints

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
[$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> CompressionFormat

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>ExtendedS3DestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_s3BackupMode</a> - The Amazon S3
--   backup mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupDescription:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_s3BackupDescription</a> - The
--   configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_prefix</a> - The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH"
--   time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3
--   files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in <a>Custom
--   Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix
--   that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before
--   writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the
--   bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see
--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_dynamicPartitioningConfiguration</a>
--   - The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_dataFormatConversionConfiguration</a>
--   - The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from
--   the JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to
--   Amazon S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_processingConfiguration</a> - The
--   data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_bucketARN</a> - The ARN of the S3
--   bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and
--   AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering
--   option.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_compressionFormat</a> - The
--   compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationDescription_encryptionConfiguration</a> - The
--   encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no
--   encryption.
newExtendedS3DestinationDescription :: Text -> Text -> BufferingHints -> CompressionFormat -> EncryptionConfiguration -> ExtendedS3DestinationDescription

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_s3BackupMode :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe S3BackupMode)

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_s3BackupDescription :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe S3DestinationDescription)

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_prefix :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_errorOutputPrefix :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
extendedS3DestinationDescription_dynamicPartitioningConfiguration :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration)

-- | The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_dataFormatConversionConfiguration :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration)

-- | The data processing configuration.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_processingConfiguration :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_roleARN :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_bucketARN :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription Text

-- | The buffering option.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_bufferingHints :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription BufferingHints

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_compressionFormat :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription CompressionFormat

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
extendedS3DestinationDescription_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' ExtendedS3DestinationDescription EncryptionConfiguration

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ExtendedS3DestinationDescription.ExtendedS3DestinationDescription

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration
ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe S3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can
--   update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is
--   enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe S3BackupMode

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3BackupConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
[$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   UNCOMPRESSED.
[$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
[$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--

--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_s3BackupConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix
--   that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before
--   writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the
--   bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see
--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.

--   S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can
--   update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is
--   enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.

--   S3.

newSourceDescription :: SourceDescription

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SplunkRetryOptions
SplunkRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk
--   fails. It doesn't include the periods during which Kinesis Data
--   Firehose waits for acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:SplunkRetryOptions'] :: SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkRetryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:SplunkRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>splunkRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The total amount of time
--   that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries. This duration starts
--   after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk fails. It doesn't
--   include the periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
newSplunkRetryOptions :: SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk
--   fails. It doesn't include the periods during which Kinesis Data
--   Firehose waits for acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
splunkRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkRetryOptions.SplunkRetryOptions


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkS3BackupMode
newtype SplunkS3BackupMode
SplunkS3BackupMode' :: Text -> SplunkS3BackupMode
[fromSplunkS3BackupMode] :: SplunkS3BackupMode -> Text
pattern SplunkS3BackupMode_AllEvents :: SplunkS3BackupMode
pattern SplunkS3BackupMode_FailedEventsOnly :: SplunkS3BackupMode

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkDestinationUpdate

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkDestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data SplunkDestinationUpdate
SplunkDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HECEndpointType -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationUpdate

-- | Specifies how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to
--   Amazon S3. When set to <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured
--   Amazon S3 destination. When set to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes
--   failed documents to Amazon S3. The default value is
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode

-- | A GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new
--   HEC endpoint.
[$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
[$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HECEndpointType

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
[$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Natural

-- | Your update to the configuration of the backup Amazon S3 location.
[$sel:s3Update:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
[$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
[$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkDestinationUpdate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to

--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.

newSplunkDestinationUpdate :: SplunkDestinationUpdate

--   Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkDestinationDescription

-- | Describes a destination in Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkDestinationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data SplunkDestinationDescription
SplunkDestinationDescription' :: Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HECEndpointType -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationDescription

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode

-- | A GUID you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC
--   endpoint.
[$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
[$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe HECEndpointType

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
[$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.&gt;
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
[$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
[$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.SplunkDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SplunkDestinationConfiguration
SplunkDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> HECEndpointType -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationConfiguration

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data that
--   could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set
--   to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming
--   records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3.
--   The default value is <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
[$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Natural

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
[$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
[$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
[$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> HECEndpointType

-- | This is a GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you
--   create a new HEC endpoint.
[$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
[$sel:s3Configuration:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

newSplunkDestinationConfiguration :: Text -> HECEndpointType -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationConfiguration

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
