module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag

-- | Metadata that you can assign to a delivery stream, consisting of a
--   key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | An optional string, which you can use to describe or define the tag.
--   Maximum length: 256 characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters,
--   digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid
--   characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - An optional string, which
--   you can use to describe or define the tag. Maximum length: 256
--   characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _
--   . / = + - % @
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid characters: Unicode
--   letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | An optional string, which you can use to describe or define the tag.
--   Maximum length: 256 characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters,
--   digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid
--   characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.Types.Tag.Tag


module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfiguration

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VpcConfiguration
VpcConfiguration' :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> VpcConfiguration

-- | The IDs of the subnets that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that
--   the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to
--   flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that
--   have the destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified
--   here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfiguration'] :: VpcConfiguration -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
[$sel:roleARN:VpcConfiguration'] :: VpcConfiguration -> Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   use when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You
--   can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or
--   different ones. If you specify different security groups here, ensure
--   that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's
--   security group. Also ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group
--   allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you
--   use the same security group for both your delivery stream and the
--   Amazon ES domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows
--   HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see
--   <a>Security group rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfiguration'] :: VpcConfiguration -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfiguration_subnetIds</a> - The IDs of the subnets that you
--   want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to create ENIs in the VPC of the
--   Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing tables and inbound
--   and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the subnets whose IDs
--   are specified here to the subnets that have the destination Amazon ES
--   endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at least one ENI in each of
--   the subnets that are specified here. Do not delete or modify these
--   ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:VpcConfiguration'</a>, <a>vpcConfiguration_roleARN</a>
--   - The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfiguration_securityGroupIds</a> - The IDs of the security
--   groups that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use when it creates ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the same security
--   group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones. If you specify
--   different security groups here, ensure that they allow outbound HTTPS
--   traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also ensure that the
--   Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic from the
--   security groups specified here. If you use the same security group for
--   both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make sure the
--   security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more information
--   about security group rules, see <a>Security group rules</a> in the
--   Amazon VPC documentation.
newVpcConfiguration :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> VpcConfiguration

-- | The IDs of the subnets that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that
--   the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to
--   flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that
--   have the destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified
--   here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
vpcConfiguration_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
vpcConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' VpcConfiguration Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   use when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You
--   can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or
--   different ones. If you specify different security groups here, ensure
--   that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's
--   security group. Also ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group
--   allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you
--   use the same security group for both your delivery stream and the
--   Amazon ES domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows
--   HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see
--   <a>Security group rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
vpcConfiguration_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfiguration.VpcConfiguration

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration
ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe VpcConfiguration -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration

-- | The Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to the <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of
--   old data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon
--   ES Destination</a>. The default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
[$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod

-- | The Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only
--   one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing
--   index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an
--   error during run time.
--   
--   For Elasticsearch 7.x, don't specify a <tt>TypeName</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set
--   to <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any
--   documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3
--   destination, with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the key
--   prefix. When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed
--   documents with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the prefix.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Backup for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can't change this backup mode after you create the delivery
--   stream.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode

-- | The ARN of the Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions
--   for <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the role
--   specified in <b>RoleARN</b>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
[$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
[$sel:vpcConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe VpcConfiguration

-- | The buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values
--   for <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> are used.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
[$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify
--   either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
[$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by
--   Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and
--   for indexing documents. For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis
--   Data Firehose Access to an Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Elasticsearch index name.
[$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
[$sel:s3Configuration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_indexRotationPeriod</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to the <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of
--   old data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon
--   ES Destination</a>. The default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_typeName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one
--   type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index
--   that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error
--   during run time.
--   
--   For Elasticsearch 7.x, don't specify a <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - Defines
--   how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any
--   documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3
--   destination, with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the key
--   prefix. When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed
--   documents with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the prefix.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Backup for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can't change this backup mode after you create the delivery
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_domainARN</a> - The ARN of
--   the Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions for
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the role
--   specified in <b>RoleARN</b>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a>
--   - The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_vpcConfiguration</a> - The
--   details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values for
--   <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents
--   to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   The data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_clusterEndpoint</a> - The
--   endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify either
--   this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data
--   Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and for indexing
--   documents. For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis Data Firehose
--   Access to an Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_indexName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> - The
--   configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
newElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration

-- | The Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to the <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of
--   old data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon
--   ES Destination</a>. The default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_indexRotationPeriod :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod)

-- | The Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only
--   one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing
--   index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an
--   error during run time.
--   
--   For Elasticsearch 7.x, don't specify a <tt>TypeName</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_typeName :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set
--   to <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any
--   documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3
--   destination, with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the key

--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.

--   stream.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode)

-- | The ARN of the Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions
--   for <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the role
--   specified in <b>RoleARN</b>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_domainARN :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_vpcConfiguration :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe VpcConfiguration)

-- | The buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values
--   for <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> are used.
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints)

--   documents to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions)

elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_clusterEndpoint :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration

data AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration

[$sel:indexRotationPeriod:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
[$sel:typeName:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text
[$sel:s3BackupMode:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode

[$sel:bufferingHints:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceBufferingHints

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>amazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration_indexRotationPeriod</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>amazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration_typeName</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfigurationDescription

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcConfigurationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VpcConfigurationDescription
VpcConfigurationDescription' :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> Text -> VpcConfigurationDescription

-- | The IDs of the subnets that Kinesis Data Firehose uses to create ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing
--   tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the
--   subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the
--   destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at
--   least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not
--   delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that the delivery stream uses to create
--   endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either
--   case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose service
--   principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
[$sel:roleARN:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that Kinesis Data Firehose uses when it
--   creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the
--   same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones.
--   If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow
--   outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also
--   ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic
--   from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security
--   group for both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make
--   sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more
--   information about security group rules, see <a>Security group
--   rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon ES destination's VPC.
[$sel:vpcId:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcConfigurationDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfigurationDescription_subnetIds</a> - The IDs of the subnets
--   that Kinesis Data Firehose uses to create ENIs in the VPC of the
--   Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing tables and inbound
--   and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the subnets whose IDs
--   are specified here to the subnets that have the destination Amazon ES
--   endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at least one ENI in each of
--   the subnets that are specified here. Do not delete or modify these
--   ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:VpcConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfigurationDescription_roleARN</a> - The ARN of the IAM role
--   that the delivery stream uses to create endpoints in the destination
--   VPC. You can use your existing Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or
--   you can specify a new role. In either case, make sure that the role
--   trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose service principal and that it grants
--   the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfigurationDescription_securityGroupIds</a> - The IDs of the
--   security groups that Kinesis Data Firehose uses when it creates ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the same security
--   group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones. If you specify
--   different security groups, ensure that they allow outbound HTTPS
--   traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also ensure that the
--   Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic from the
--   security groups specified here. If you use the same security group for
--   both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make sure the
--   security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more information
--   about security group rules, see <a>Security group rules</a> in the
--   Amazon VPC documentation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:VpcConfigurationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfigurationDescription_vpcId</a> - The ID of the Amazon ES
--   destination's VPC.
newVpcConfigurationDescription :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> Text -> VpcConfigurationDescription

-- | The IDs of the subnets that Kinesis Data Firehose uses to create ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing
--   tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the
--   subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the
--   destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at
--   least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not
--   delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
vpcConfigurationDescription_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that the delivery stream uses to create
--   endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either
--   case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose service
--   principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
vpcConfigurationDescription_roleARN :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that Kinesis Data Firehose uses when it
--   creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the
--   same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones.
--   If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow
--   outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also
--   ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic
--   from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security
--   group for both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make
--   sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more
--   information about security group rules, see <a>Security group
--   rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
vpcConfigurationDescription_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon ES destination's VPC.
vpcConfigurationDescription_vpcId :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfigurationDescription.VpcConfigurationDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.VpcConfigurationDescription.VpcConfigurationDescription

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.ElasticsearchDestinationDescription

-- | The destination description in Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchDestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ElasticsearchDestinationDescription
ElasticsearchDestinationDescription' :: Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VpcConfigurationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ElasticsearchDestinationDescription

-- | The Elasticsearch index rotation period
[$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod

-- | The Elasticsearch type name. This applies to Elasticsearch 6.x and
--   lower versions. For Elasticsearch 7.x, there's no value for
--   <tt>TypeName</tt>.
[$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode

-- | The ARN of the Amazon ES domain. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose uses either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>DomainARN</tt> to send data to Amazon ES.
[$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
[$sel:vpcConfigurationDescription:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe VpcConfigurationDescription

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | The buffering options.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | The Amazon ES retry options.
[$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the
--   <tt>DomainARN</tt> field to send data to Amazon ES.
[$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Elasticsearch index name.
[$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'] :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,

--   Elasticsearch index rotation period
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_typeName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch type name. This applies to Elasticsearch 6.x and lower
--   versions. For Elasticsearch 7.x, there's no value for
--   <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,

--   S3 backup mode.

--   Amazon ES domain. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names

--   The Amazon CloudWatch logging options.

--   The Amazon S3 destination.

--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options.

--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_retryOptions</a> - The Amazon
--   ES retry options.

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_clusterEndpoint</a> - The

--   Firehose uses either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the

--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_indexName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index name.

--   lower versions. For Elasticsearch 7.x, there's no value for
--   <tt>TypeName</tt>.
elasticsearchDestinationDescription_typeName :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode.
elasticsearchDestinationDescription_s3BackupMode :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationDescription (Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode)

-- | The ARN of the Amazon ES domain. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose uses either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>DomainARN</tt> to send data to Amazon ES.

--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
elasticsearchDestinationDescription_roleARN :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription</a>
--   smart constructor.
data AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription
AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription' :: Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VpcConfigurationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceBufferingHints -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription
[$sel:indexRotationPeriod:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
[$sel:typeName:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text
[$sel:s3BackupMode:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode
[$sel:domainARN:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text
[$sel:vpcConfigurationDescription:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe VpcConfigurationDescription
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription
[$sel:bufferingHints:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceBufferingHints
[$sel:retryOptions:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions
[$sel:processingConfiguration:AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DestinationDescription

-- | Describes the destination for a delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestinationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data DestinationDescription
DestinationDescription' :: Maybe SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe ExtendedS3DestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchDestinationDescription -> Maybe RedshiftDestinationDescription -> Text -> DestinationDescription

-- | The destination in Splunk.
[$sel:splunkDestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe SplunkDestinationDescription
[$sel:amazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription

-- | Describes the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:httpEndpointDestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointDestinationDescription

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Deprecated</i> The destination in Amazon S3.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | The destination in Amazon S3.
[$sel:extendedS3DestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe ExtendedS3DestinationDescription

-- | The destination in Amazon ES.
[$sel:elasticsearchDestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchDestinationDescription

-- | The destination in Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:redshiftDestinationDescription:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Maybe RedshiftDestinationDescription

-- | The ID of the destination.
[$sel:destinationId:DestinationDescription'] :: DestinationDescription -> Text

--   fields omitted.

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamDescription

-- | Contains information about a delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryStreamDescription</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryStreamDescription
DeliveryStreamDescription' :: Maybe FailureDescription -> Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe SourceDescription -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> DeliveryStreamStatus -> DeliveryStreamType -> Text -> [DestinationDescription] -> Bool -> DeliveryStreamDescription

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
[$sel:failureDescription:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Maybe FailureDescription

-- | Indicates the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery
--   stream.
[$sel:deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration

-- | The date and time that the delivery stream was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If the <tt>DeliveryStreamType</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>, a SourceDescription object describing
--   the source Kinesis data stream.
[$sel:source:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Maybe SourceDescription

-- | The date and time that the delivery stream was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTimestamp:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the delivery stream.
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:deliveryStreamARN:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Text

-- | The status of the delivery stream. If the status of a delivery stream
--   is <tt>CREATING_FAILED</tt>, this status doesn't change, and you can't
--   invoke <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> again on it. However, you can
--   invoke the DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it.
[$sel:deliveryStreamStatus:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> DeliveryStreamStatus

-- | The delivery stream type. This can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DirectPut</tt>: Provider applications access the delivery
--   stream directly.</li>
--   <li><tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis
--   data stream as a source.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryStreamType:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> DeliveryStreamType

-- | Each time the destination is updated for a delivery stream, the
--   version ID is changed, and the current version ID is required when
--   updating the destination. This is so that the service knows it is
--   applying the changes to the correct version of the delivery stream.
[$sel:versionId:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Text

-- | The destinations.
[$sel:destinations:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> [DestinationDescription]

-- | Indicates whether there are more destinations available to list.
[$sel:hasMoreDestinations:DeliveryStreamDescription'] :: DeliveryStreamDescription -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryStreamDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDescription:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_failureDescription</a> - Provides details
--   in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related
--   to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</a>
--   - Indicates the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_createTimestamp</a> - The date and time
--   that the delivery stream was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_source</a> - If the
--   <tt>DeliveryStreamType</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>, a SourceDescription object describing
--   the source Kinesis data stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTimestamp:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_lastUpdateTimestamp</a> - The date and
--   time that the delivery stream was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of the
--   delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamARN:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamStatus:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamStatus</a> - The status of
--   the delivery stream. If the status of a delivery stream is
--   <tt>CREATING_FAILED</tt>, this status doesn't change, and you can't
--   invoke <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> again on it. However, you can
--   invoke the DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamType:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamType</a> - The delivery
--   stream type. This can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DirectPut</tt>: Provider applications access the delivery
--   stream directly.</li>
--   <li><tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis
--   data stream as a source.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_versionId</a> - Each time the destination
--   is updated for a delivery stream, the version ID is changed, and the
--   current version ID is required when updating the destination. This is
--   so that the service knows it is applying the changes to the correct
--   version of the delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_destinations</a> - The destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasMoreDestinations:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_hasMoreDestinations</a> - Indicates
--   whether there are more destinations available to list.
newDeliveryStreamDescription :: Text -> Text -> DeliveryStreamStatus -> DeliveryStreamType -> Text -> Bool -> DeliveryStreamDescription

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
deliveryStreamDescription_failureDescription :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription (Maybe FailureDescription)

-- | Indicates the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery
--   stream.
deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription (Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The date and time that the delivery stream was created.
deliveryStreamDescription_createTimestamp :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the <tt>DeliveryStreamType</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>, a SourceDescription object describing
--   the source Kinesis data stream.
deliveryStreamDescription_source :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription (Maybe SourceDescription)

-- | The date and time that the delivery stream was last updated.
deliveryStreamDescription_lastUpdateTimestamp :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the delivery stream.
deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamName :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamARN :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription Text

-- | The status of the delivery stream. If the status of a delivery stream
--   is <tt>CREATING_FAILED</tt>, this status doesn't change, and you can't
--   invoke <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> again on it. However, you can
--   invoke the DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it.
deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamStatus :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription DeliveryStreamStatus

-- | The delivery stream type. This can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DirectPut</tt>: Provider applications access the delivery
--   stream directly.</li>
--   <li><tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis
--   data stream as a source.</li>
--   </ul>
deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamType :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription DeliveryStreamType

-- | Each time the destination is updated for a delivery stream, the
--   version ID is changed, and the current version ID is required when
--   updating the destination. This is so that the service knows it is
--   applying the changes to the correct version of the delivery stream.
deliveryStreamDescription_versionId :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription Text

-- | The destinations.
deliveryStreamDescription_destinations :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription [DestinationDescription]

-- | Indicates whether there are more destinations available to list.
deliveryStreamDescription_hasMoreDestinations :: Lens' DeliveryStreamDescription Bool
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamDescription.DeliveryStreamDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamDescription.DeliveryStreamDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Firehose.Types.DeliveryStreamDescription.DeliveryStreamDescription

module Amazonka.Firehose.Types

-- | API version <tt>2015-08-04</tt> of the Amazon Kinesis Firehose SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The specified input parameter has a value that is not valid.
_InvalidArgumentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose throws this exception when an attempt to put
--   records or to start or stop delivery stream encryption fails. This
--   happens when the KMS service throws one of the following exception
--   types: <tt>AccessDeniedException</tt>, <tt>InvalidStateException</tt>,
--   <tt>DisabledException</tt>, or <tt>NotFoundException</tt>.
_InvalidKMSResourceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Another modification has already happened. Fetch <tt>VersionId</tt>
--   again and use it to update the destination.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service is unavailable. Back off and retry the operation. If you
--   continue to see the exception, throughput limits for the delivery
--   stream may have been exceeded. For more information about limits and
--   how to request an increase, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   Limits</a>.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource could not be found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have already reached the limit for a requested resource.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is already in use and not available for this operation.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod' :: Text -> AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
[fromAmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod] :: AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod -> Text
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod_NoRotation :: AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod_OneDay :: AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod_OneHour :: AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod_OneMonth :: AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod_OneWeek :: AmazonopensearchserviceIndexRotationPeriod

AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode' :: Text -> AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode
[fromAmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode] :: AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode -> Text
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode_AllDocuments :: AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode
pattern AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode_FailedDocumentsOnly :: AmazonopensearchserviceS3BackupMode

pattern CompressionFormat_ZIP :: CompressionFormat

pattern ContentEncoding_NONE :: ContentEncoding
newtype DeliveryStreamEncryptionStatus

pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_KMS_KEY_NOT_FOUND :: DeliveryStreamFailureType

pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_RETIRE_KMS_GRANT_FAILED :: DeliveryStreamFailureType
pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_SECURITY_GROUP_ACCESS_DENIED :: DeliveryStreamFailureType
pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_SECURITY_GROUP_NOT_FOUND :: DeliveryStreamFailureType
pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_SUBNET_ACCESS_DENIED :: DeliveryStreamFailureType
pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_SUBNET_NOT_FOUND :: DeliveryStreamFailureType
pattern DeliveryStreamFailureType_UNKNOWN_ERROR :: DeliveryStreamFailureType
newtype DeliveryStreamStatus
DeliveryStreamStatus' :: Text -> DeliveryStreamStatus
[fromDeliveryStreamStatus] :: DeliveryStreamStatus -> Text

pattern DeliveryStreamStatus_CREATING :: DeliveryStreamStatus
pattern DeliveryStreamStatus_CREATING_FAILED :: DeliveryStreamStatus
pattern DeliveryStreamStatus_DELETING :: DeliveryStreamStatus
pattern DeliveryStreamStatus_DELETING_FAILED :: DeliveryStreamStatus

pattern DeliveryStreamType_KinesisStreamAsSource :: DeliveryStreamType

data AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions
AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions
[$sel:durationInSeconds:AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions'] :: AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
