elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by
--   Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and
--   for indexing documents. For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis
--   Data Firehose Access to an Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_roleARN :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify
--   either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_clusterEndpoint :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The Elasticsearch index name.
elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexName :: Lens' ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchRetryOptions
ElasticsearchRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of
--   time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including
--   the first attempt). After this time has elapsed, the failed documents
--   are written to Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A
--   value of 0 (zero) results in no retries.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:ElasticsearchRetryOptions'] :: ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchRetryOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:ElasticsearchRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - After an initial
--   failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of time during which
--   Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including the first attempt).
--   After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A value of 0
--   (zero) results in no retries.
newElasticsearchRetryOptions :: ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of
--   time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including
--   the first attempt). After this time has elapsed, the failed documents
--   are written to Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A
--   value of 0 (zero) results in no retries.
elasticsearchRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' ElasticsearchRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes the encryption for a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EncryptionConfiguration
EncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe NoEncryptionConfig -> Maybe KMSEncryptionConfig -> EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that
--   no encryption is used.
[$sel:noEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'] :: EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe NoEncryptionConfig

-- | The encryption key.
[$sel:kmsEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'] :: EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe KMSEncryptionConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>EncryptionConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfiguration_noEncryptionConfig</a> - Specifically
--   override existing encryption information to ensure that no encryption
--   is used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsEncryptionConfig:EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfiguration_kmsEncryptionConfig</a> - The encryption
--   key.
newEncryptionConfiguration :: EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that
--   no encryption is used.
encryptionConfiguration_noEncryptionConfig :: Lens' EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe NoEncryptionConfig)

-- | The encryption key.
encryptionConfiguration_kmsEncryptionConfig :: Lens' EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe KMSEncryptionConfig)

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration
ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe S3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can
--   update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is
--   enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe S3BackupMode

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3BackupConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
[$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   UNCOMPRESSED.
[$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
[$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.

--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,

--   S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExtendedS3DestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate
ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate' :: Maybe S3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate

-- | You can update a delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is
--   disabled. If backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream
--   to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3BackupMode

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon S3 destination for backup.
[$sel:s3BackupUpdate:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
[$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
[$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option.
[$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3.
[$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate'] :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

--   fields omitted.

--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.

--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newExtendedS3DestinationUpdate :: ExtendedS3DestinationUpdate

-- | You can update a delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is
--   disabled. If backup is enabled, you can't update the delivery stream
--   to disable it.

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureDescription</a> smart constructor.
data FailureDescription
FailureDescription' :: DeliveryStreamFailureType -> Text -> FailureDescription

-- | The type of error that caused the failure.
[$sel:type':FailureDescription'] :: FailureDescription -> DeliveryStreamFailureType

-- | A message providing details about the error that caused the failure.
[$sel:details:FailureDescription'] :: FailureDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':FailureDescription'</a>, <a>failureDescription_type</a>
--   - The type of error that caused the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:FailureDescription'</a>,
--   <a>failureDescription_details</a> - A message providing details about
--   the error that caused the failure.
newFailureDescription :: DeliveryStreamFailureType -> Text -> FailureDescription

-- | The type of error that caused the failure.
failureDescription_type :: Lens' FailureDescription DeliveryStreamFailureType

-- | A message providing details about the error that caused the failure.
failureDescription_details :: Lens' FailureDescription Text

-- | The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose
--   for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format
--   in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one
--   offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX
--   SerDe.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHiveJsonSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data HiveJsonSerDe
HiveJsonSerDe' :: Maybe [Text] -> HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Indicates how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to parse the date and
--   timestamps that may be present in your input data JSON. To specify
--   these format strings, follow the pattern syntax of JodaTime's
--   DateTimeFormat format strings. For more information, see <a>Class
--   DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the special value <tt>millis</tt>
--   to parse timestamps in epoch milliseconds. If you don't specify a
--   format, Kinesis Data Firehose uses
--   <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
[$sel:timestampFormats:HiveJsonSerDe'] :: HiveJsonSerDe -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>HiveJsonSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampFormats:HiveJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>hiveJsonSerDe_timestampFormats</a> - Indicates how you want Kinesis
--   Data Firehose to parse the date and timestamps that may be present in
--   your input data JSON. To specify these format strings, follow the
--   pattern syntax of JodaTime's DateTimeFormat format strings. For more
--   information, see <a>Class DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the
--   special value <tt>millis</tt> to parse timestamps in epoch
--   milliseconds. If you don't specify a format, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   uses <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
newHiveJsonSerDe :: HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Indicates how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to parse the date and
--   timestamps that may be present in your input data JSON. To specify
--   these format strings, follow the pattern syntax of JodaTime's
--   DateTimeFormat format strings. For more information, see <a>Class
--   DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the special value <tt>millis</tt>
--   to parse timestamps in epoch milliseconds. If you don't specify a
--   format, Kinesis Data Firehose uses
--   <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
hiveJsonSerDe_timestampFormats :: Lens' HiveJsonSerDe (Maybe [Text])

-- | Describes the buffering options that can be applied before data is
--   delivered to the HTTP endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   treats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointBufferingHints
HttpEndpointBufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
[$sel:sizeInMBs:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'] :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5
--   minutes).
[$sel:intervalInSeconds:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'] :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointBufferingHints</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointBufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a> - Buffer incoming data to
--   the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination.
--   The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming
--   data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
newHttpEndpointBufferingHints :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
httpEndpointBufferingHints_sizeInMBs :: Lens' HttpEndpointBufferingHints (Maybe Natural)

-- | Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds,
--   before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5
--   minutes).
httpEndpointBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds :: Lens' HttpEndpointBufferingHints (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint to which Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointConfiguration
HttpEndpointConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Sensitive Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration

-- | The name of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
[$sel:name:HttpEndpointConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The access key required for Kinesis Firehose to authenticate with the
--   HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
[$sel:accessKey:HttpEndpointConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

--   
--   If you choose an HTTP endpoint as your destination, review and follow
--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.
[$sel:url:HttpEndpointConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   selected as the destination.

--   for Kinesis Firehose to authenticate with the HTTP endpoint selected
--   as the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:HttpEndpointConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointConfiguration_url</a> - The URL of the HTTP endpoint
--   selected as the destination.

--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.

--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.
httpEndpointConfiguration_url :: Lens' HttpEndpointConfiguration Text

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration
HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
[$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
[$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions
[$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the requeste sent to the HTTP endpoint specified
--   as the destination.
[$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
[$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
[$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointConfiguration
[$sel:s3Configuration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - Describes
--   the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up all
--   documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint destination
--   (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - Describes
--   the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it doesn't
--   receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified HTTP
--   endpoint destination.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_requestConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration of the requeste sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that the delivery
--   stream needs.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_endpointConfiguration</a> -
--   The configuration of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newHttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints)

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions)

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The configuration of the requeste sent to the HTTP endpoint specified
--   as the destination.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_requestConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration)

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_endpointConfiguration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration HttpEndpointConfiguration

-- | Undocumented member.
httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration :: Lens' HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes the HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointDestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HttpEndpointDestinationDescription
HttpEndpointDestinationDescription' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointDestinationDescription

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
[$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it
--   is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
[$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | The configuration of the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointDescription
[$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The configuration of request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
[$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
[$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Updates the specified HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointDestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate

-- | Describes the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis
--   Firehose delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up
--   all documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis
--   Data Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
[$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions
[$sel:s3Update:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it
--   is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
[$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointConfiguration
[$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The configuration of the request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified
--   as the destination.
[$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that
--   the delivery stream needs.
[$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate'] :: HttpEndpointDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration of the HTTP endpoint request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointRequestConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration
HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration' :: Maybe [HttpEndpointCommonAttribute] -> Maybe ContentEncoding -> HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Describes the metadata sent to the HTTP endpoint destination.
[$sel:commonAttributes:HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe [HttpEndpointCommonAttribute]

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses the content encoding to compress the body
--   of a request before sending the request to the destination. For more
--   information, see <a>Content-Encoding</a> in MDN Web Docs, the official
--   Mozilla documentation.
[$sel:contentEncoding:HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration'] :: HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe ContentEncoding

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>httpEndpointRequestConfiguration_commonAttributes</a> - Describes
--   the metadata sent to the HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentEncoding:HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointRequestConfiguration_contentEncoding</a> - Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses the content encoding to compress the body of a request
--   before sending the request to the destination. For more information,
--   see <a>Content-Encoding</a> in MDN Web Docs, the official Mozilla
--   documentation.
newHttpEndpointRequestConfiguration :: HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Describes the metadata sent to the HTTP endpoint destination.
httpEndpointRequestConfiguration_commonAttributes :: Lens' HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration (Maybe [HttpEndpointCommonAttribute])

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose uses the content encoding to compress the body
--   of a request before sending the request to the destination. For more
--   information, see <a>Content-Encoding</a> in MDN Web Docs, the official
--   Mozilla documentation.
httpEndpointRequestConfiguration_contentEncoding :: Lens' HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration (Maybe ContentEncoding)

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointRetryOptions
HttpEndpointRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to the
--   custom destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the
--   periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment
--   from the specified destination after each attempt.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:HttpEndpointRetryOptions'] :: HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointRetryOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:HttpEndpointRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The total amount
--   of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries. This duration
--   starts after the initial attempt to send data to the custom
--   destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the periods
--   during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment from the
--   specified destination after each attempt.
newHttpEndpointRetryOptions :: HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to the
--   custom destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the
--   periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment
--   from the specified destination after each attempt.
httpEndpointRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' HttpEndpointRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the deserializer you want to use to convert the format of
--   the input data. This parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set
--   to true.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputFormatConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data InputFormatConfiguration
InputFormatConfiguration' :: Maybe Deserializer -> InputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache
--   Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the
--   server rejects the request.
[$sel:deserializer:InputFormatConfiguration'] :: InputFormatConfiguration -> Maybe Deserializer

-- | Create a value of <a>InputFormatConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deserializer:InputFormatConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inputFormatConfiguration_deserializer</a> - Specifies which
--   deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache Hive JSON SerDe
--   or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
newInputFormatConfiguration :: InputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache
--   Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the
--   server rejects the request.
inputFormatConfiguration_deserializer :: Lens' InputFormatConfiguration (Maybe Deserializer)

-- | Describes an encryption key for a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKMSEncryptionConfig</a> smart constructor.
data KMSEncryptionConfig
KMSEncryptionConfig' :: Text -> KMSEncryptionConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to
--   the same AWS Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:aWSKMSKeyARN:KMSEncryptionConfig'] :: KMSEncryptionConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KMSEncryptionConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aWSKMSKeyARN:KMSEncryptionConfig'</a>,
--   <a>kmsEncryptionConfig_aWSKMSKeyARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to the same AWS Region as the
--   destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newKMSEncryptionConfig :: Text -> KMSEncryptionConfig

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to
--   the same AWS Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
kmsEncryptionConfig_aWSKMSKeyARN :: Lens' KMSEncryptionConfig Text

-- | Details about a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisStreamSourceDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data KinesisStreamSourceDescription
KinesisStreamSourceDescription' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KinesisStreamSourceDescription

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data
--   stream starting with this timestamp.
[$sel:deliveryStartTimestamp:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'] :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For
--   more information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
[$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'] :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN
--   Format</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'] :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisStreamSourceDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStartTimestamp:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_deliveryStartTimestamp</a> - Kinesis
--   Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data stream
--   starting with this timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_kinesisStreamARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_roleARN</a> - The ARN of the role
--   used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see
--   <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN Format</a>.
newKinesisStreamSourceDescription :: KinesisStreamSourceDescription

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data
--   stream starting with this timestamp.
kinesisStreamSourceDescription_deliveryStartTimestamp :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For
--   more information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
kinesisStreamSourceDescription_kinesisStreamARN :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN
--   Format</a>.
kinesisStreamSourceDescription_roleARN :: Lens' KinesisStreamSourceDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data,
--   which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for
--   serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two
--   deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the
--   functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog
--   JsonSerDe.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOpenXJsonSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data OpenXJsonSerDe
OpenXJsonSerDe' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> OpenXJsonSerDe

-- | Maps column names to JSON keys that aren't identical to the column
--   names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive
--   keywords. For example, <tt>timestamp</tt> is a Hive keyword. If you
--   have a JSON key named <tt>timestamp</tt>, set this parameter to
--   <tt>{"ts": "timestamp"}</tt> to map this key to a column named
--   <tt>ts</tt>.
[$sel:columnToJsonKeyMappings:OpenXJsonSerDe'] :: OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.
[$sel:caseInsensitive:OpenXJsonSerDe'] :: OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, specifies that the names of the keys
--   include dots and that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them
--   with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow
--   dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose
--   name is "a.b", you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using
--   this option.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores:OpenXJsonSerDe'] :: OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>OpenXJsonSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:columnToJsonKeyMappings:OpenXJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>openXJsonSerDe_columnToJsonKeyMappings</a> - Maps column names to
--   JSON keys that aren't identical to the column names. This is useful
--   when the JSON contains keys that are Hive keywords. For example,
--   <tt>timestamp</tt> is a Hive keyword. If you have a JSON key named
--   <tt>timestamp</tt>, set this parameter to <tt>{"ts": "timestamp"}</tt>
--   to map this key to a column named <tt>ts</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseInsensitive:OpenXJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>openXJsonSerDe_caseInsensitive</a> - When set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose converts JSON keys to
--   lowercase before deserializing them.
--   
--   <a>$sel:convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores:OpenXJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>openXJsonSerDe_convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, specifies that the names of the keys include dots and
--   that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them with underscores.
--   This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow dots in column
--   names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose name is "a.b",
--   you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using this option.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
newOpenXJsonSerDe :: OpenXJsonSerDe

-- | Maps column names to JSON keys that aren't identical to the column
--   names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive
--   keywords. For example, <tt>timestamp</tt> is a Hive keyword. If you
--   have a JSON key named <tt>timestamp</tt>, set this parameter to
--   <tt>{"ts": "timestamp"}</tt> to map this key to a column named
--   <tt>ts</tt>.
openXJsonSerDe_columnToJsonKeyMappings :: Lens' OpenXJsonSerDe (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.
openXJsonSerDe_caseInsensitive :: Lens' OpenXJsonSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, specifies that the names of the keys
--   include dots and that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them
--   with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow
--   dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose
--   name is "a.b", you can define the column name to be "a_b" when using
--   this option.
--   
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
openXJsonSerDe_convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores :: Lens' OpenXJsonSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrcSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data OrcSerDe
OrcSerDe' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe OrcCompression -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe OrcFormatVersion -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Double -> OrcSerDe

-- | The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP,
--   the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is
--   0, and the maximum is 1.
[$sel:bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Double

-- | Represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn
--   off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less
--   than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use
--   dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.
[$sel:dictionaryKeyThreshold:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Double

-- | Set this to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that you want stripes to be
--   padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to
--   copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:enablePadding:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is
--   <tt>SNAPPY</tt>.
[$sel:compression:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe OrcCompression

-- | The column names for which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to create
--   bloom filters. The default is <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:bloomFilterColumns:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and
--   the minimum is 1,000.
[$sel:rowIndexStride:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | The version of the file to write. The possible values are
--   <tt>V0_11</tt> and <tt>V0_12</tt>. The default is <tt>V0_12</tt>.
[$sel:formatVersion:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe OrcFormatVersion

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
[$sel:blockSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the
--   minimum is 8 MiB.
[$sel:stripeSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | A number between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding
--   as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which
--   means 5 percent of stripe size.
--   
--   For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks,
--   the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of
--   3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the
--   available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller
--   stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no
--   stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a
--   node-local task.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when
--   OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:paddingTolerance:OrcSerDe'] :: OrcSerDe -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>OrcSerDe</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability</a> - The Bloom filter
--   false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP, the bigger the
--   Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is 0, and the
--   maximum is 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dictionaryKeyThreshold:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_dictionaryKeyThreshold</a> - Represents the fraction of
--   the total number of non-null rows. To turn off dictionary encoding,
--   set this fraction to a number that is less than the number of distinct
--   keys in a dictionary. To always use dictionary encoding, set this
--   threshold to 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enablePadding:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_enablePadding</a> -
--   Set this to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that you want stripes to be
--   padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to
--   copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compression:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_compression</a> - The
--   compression code to use over data blocks. The default is
--   <tt>SNAPPY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bloomFilterColumns:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_bloomFilterColumns</a> - The column names for which you
--   want Kinesis Data Firehose to create bloom filters. The default is
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rowIndexStride:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_rowIndexStride</a> -
--   The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and
--   the minimum is 1,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formatVersion:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_formatVersion</a> -
--   The version of the file to write. The possible values are
--   <tt>V0_11</tt> and <tt>V0_12</tt>. The default is <tt>V0_12</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_blockSizeBytes</a> -
--   The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stripeSizeBytes:OrcSerDe'</a>, <a>orcSerDe_stripeSizeBytes</a>
--   - The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the
--   minimum is 8 MiB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:paddingTolerance:OrcSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>orcSerDe_paddingTolerance</a> - A number between 0 and 1 that
--   defines the tolerance for block padding as a decimal fraction of
--   stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which means 5 percent of
--   stripe size.
--   
--   For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks,
--   the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of
--   3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the
--   available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller
--   stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no
--   stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a
--   node-local task.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when
--   OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is <tt>false</tt>.
newOrcSerDe :: OrcSerDe

-- | The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP,
--   the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is
--   0, and the maximum is 1.
orcSerDe_bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Double)

-- | Represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn
--   off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less
--   than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use
--   dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.
orcSerDe_dictionaryKeyThreshold :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Double)

-- | Set this to <tt>true</tt> to indicate that you want stripes to be
--   padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to
--   copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
orcSerDe_enablePadding :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is
--   <tt>SNAPPY</tt>.
orcSerDe_compression :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe OrcCompression)

-- | The column names for which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to create
--   bloom filters. The default is <tt>null</tt>.
orcSerDe_bloomFilterColumns :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe [Text])

-- | The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and
--   the minimum is 1,000.
orcSerDe_rowIndexStride :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | The version of the file to write. The possible values are
--   <tt>V0_11</tt> and <tt>V0_12</tt>. The default is <tt>V0_12</tt>.
orcSerDe_formatVersion :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe OrcFormatVersion)

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
orcSerDe_blockSizeBytes :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the
--   minimum is 8 MiB.
orcSerDe_stripeSizeBytes :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | A number between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding
--   as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which
--   means 5 percent of stripe size.
--   
--   For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks,
--   the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of
--   3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the
--   available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller
--   stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no
--   stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a
--   node-local task.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when
--   OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is <tt>false</tt>.
orcSerDe_paddingTolerance :: Lens' OrcSerDe (Maybe Double)

-- | Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   convert the format of your data before it writes it to Amazon S3. This
--   parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputFormatConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data OutputFormatConfiguration
OutputFormatConfiguration' :: Maybe Serializer -> OutputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe
--   or the Parquet SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
[$sel:serializer:OutputFormatConfiguration'] :: OutputFormatConfiguration -> Maybe Serializer

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputFormatConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serializer:OutputFormatConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>outputFormatConfiguration_serializer</a> - Specifies which
--   serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe or the Parquet
--   SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the request.
newOutputFormatConfiguration :: OutputFormatConfiguration

-- | Specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe
--   or the Parquet SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
outputFormatConfiguration_serializer :: Lens' OutputFormatConfiguration (Maybe Serializer)

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParquetSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data ParquetSerDe
ParquetSerDe' :: Maybe ParquetWriterVersion -> Maybe ParquetCompression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> ParquetSerDe

-- | Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are
--   <tt>V1</tt> and <tt>V2</tt>. The default is <tt>V1</tt>.
[$sel:writerVersion:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe ParquetWriterVersion

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>, <tt>SNAPPY</tt>, and <tt>GZIP</tt>, with the
--   default being <tt>SNAPPY</tt>. Use <tt>SNAPPY</tt> for higher
--   decompression speed. Use <tt>GZIP</tt> if the compression ratio is
--   more important than speed.
[$sel:compression:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe ParquetCompression

-- | The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend
--   to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default
--   is 0.
[$sel:maxPaddingBytes:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether to enable dictionary compression.
[$sel:enableDictionaryCompression:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is
--   conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and
--   encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.
[$sel:pageSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
[$sel:blockSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'] :: ParquetSerDe -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ParquetSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:writerVersion:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_writerVersion</a> - Indicates the version of row
--   format to output. The possible values are <tt>V1</tt> and <tt>V2</tt>.
--   The default is <tt>V1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compression:ParquetSerDe'</a>, <a>parquetSerDe_compression</a>
--   - The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values
--   are <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>, <tt>SNAPPY</tt>, and <tt>GZIP</tt>, with
--   the default being <tt>SNAPPY</tt>. Use <tt>SNAPPY</tt> for higher
--   decompression speed. Use <tt>GZIP</tt> if the compression ratio is
--   more important than speed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxPaddingBytes:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_maxPaddingBytes</a> - The maximum amount of padding to
--   apply. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to
--   HDFS before querying. The default is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableDictionaryCompression:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_enableDictionaryCompression</a> - Indicates whether to
--   enable dictionary compression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_pageSizeBytes</a> - The Parquet page size. Column
--   chunks are divided into pages. A page is conceptually an indivisible
--   unit (in terms of compression and encoding). The minimum value is 64
--   KiB and the default is 1 MiB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockSizeBytes:ParquetSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>parquetSerDe_blockSizeBytes</a> - The Hadoop Distributed File
--   System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the
--   data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB
--   and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data Firehose uses this value for
--   padding calculations.
newParquetSerDe :: ParquetSerDe

-- | Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are
--   <tt>V1</tt> and <tt>V2</tt>. The default is <tt>V1</tt>.
parquetSerDe_writerVersion :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe ParquetWriterVersion)

-- | The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>, <tt>SNAPPY</tt>, and <tt>GZIP</tt>, with the
--   default being <tt>SNAPPY</tt>. Use <tt>SNAPPY</tt> for higher
--   decompression speed. Use <tt>GZIP</tt> if the compression ratio is
--   more important than speed.
parquetSerDe_compression :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe ParquetCompression)

-- | The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend
--   to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default
--   is 0.
parquetSerDe_maxPaddingBytes :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether to enable dictionary compression.
parquetSerDe_enableDictionaryCompression :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is
--   conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and
--   encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.
parquetSerDe_pageSizeBytes :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful
--   if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying.
--   The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.
parquetSerDe_blockSizeBytes :: Lens' ParquetSerDe (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes a data processing configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProcessingConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ProcessingConfiguration
ProcessingConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Processor] -> ProcessingConfiguration

-- | Enables or disables data processing.
[$sel:enabled:ProcessingConfiguration'] :: ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | The data processors.
[$sel:processors:ProcessingConfiguration'] :: ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe [Processor]

-- | Create a value of <a>ProcessingConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ProcessingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>processingConfiguration_enabled</a> - Enables or disables data
--   processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processors:ProcessingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>processingConfiguration_processors</a> - The data processors.
newProcessingConfiguration :: ProcessingConfiguration

-- | Enables or disables data processing.
processingConfiguration_enabled :: Lens' ProcessingConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The data processors.
processingConfiguration_processors :: Lens' ProcessingConfiguration (Maybe [Processor])

-- | Describes a data processor.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProcessor</a> smart constructor.
data Processor
Processor' :: Maybe [ProcessorParameter] -> ProcessorType -> Processor

-- | The processor parameters.
[$sel:parameters:Processor'] :: Processor -> Maybe [ProcessorParameter]

-- | The type of processor.
[$sel:type':Processor'] :: Processor -> ProcessorType

-- | Create a value of <a>Processor</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:Processor'</a>, <a>processor_parameters</a> - The
--   processor parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Processor'</a>, <a>processor_type</a> - The type of
--   processor.
newProcessor :: ProcessorType -> Processor

-- | The processor parameters.
processor_parameters :: Lens' Processor (Maybe [ProcessorParameter])

-- | The type of processor.
processor_type :: Lens' Processor ProcessorType

-- | Describes the processor parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProcessorParameter</a> smart constructor.
data ProcessorParameter
ProcessorParameter' :: ProcessorParameterName -> Text -> ProcessorParameter

-- | The name of the parameter.
[$sel:parameterName:ProcessorParameter'] :: ProcessorParameter -> ProcessorParameterName

-- | The parameter value.
[$sel:parameterValue:ProcessorParameter'] :: ProcessorParameter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProcessorParameter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ProcessorParameter'</a>,
--   <a>processorParameter_parameterName</a> - The name of the parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:ProcessorParameter'</a>,
--   <a>processorParameter_parameterValue</a> - The parameter value.
newProcessorParameter :: ProcessorParameterName -> Text -> ProcessorParameter

-- | The name of the parameter.
processorParameter_parameterName :: Lens' ProcessorParameter ProcessorParameterName

-- | The parameter value.
processorParameter_parameterValue :: Lens' ProcessorParameter Text

-- | Contains the result for an individual record from a PutRecordBatch
--   request. If the record is successfully added to your delivery stream,
--   it receives a record ID. If the record fails to be added to your
--   delivery stream, the result includes an error code and an error
--   message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecordBatchResponseEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecordBatchResponseEntry
PutRecordBatchResponseEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PutRecordBatchResponseEntry

-- | The ID of the record.
[$sel:recordId:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'] :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The error code for an individual record result.
[$sel:errorCode:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'] :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The error message for an individual record result.
[$sel:errorMessage:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'] :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutRecordBatchResponseEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordId:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponseEntry_recordId</a> - The ID of the record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponseEntry_errorCode</a> - The error code for an
--   individual record result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:PutRecordBatchResponseEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponseEntry_errorMessage</a> - The error message
--   for an individual record result.
newPutRecordBatchResponseEntry :: PutRecordBatchResponseEntry

-- | The unit of data in a delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Base64 -> Record

-- | The data blob, which is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized.
--   The maximum size of the data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000
--   KiB.
[$sel:data':Record'] :: Record -> Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Record'</a>, <a>record_data</a> - The data blob, which
--   is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized. The maximum size of the
--   data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000 KiB.-- -- <i>Note:</i>
--   This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. --
--   The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during
--   -- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
newRecord :: ByteString -> Record

-- | The data blob, which is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized.
--   The maximum size of the data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000
--   KiB.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
record_data :: Lens' Record ByteString

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedshiftDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RedshiftDestinationConfiguration
RedshiftDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> Text -> CopyCommand -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> RedshiftDestinationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can
--   update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is
--   enabled, you can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe RedshiftS3BackupMode

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
[$sel:s3BackupConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).
[$sel:retryOptions:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The database connection string.
[$sel:clusterJDBCURL:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The <tt>COPY</tt> command.
[$sel:copyCommand:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> CopyCommand

-- | The name of the user.
[$sel:username:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Sensitive Text

-- | The user password.
[$sel:password:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> Sensitive Text

-- | The configuration for the intermediate Amazon S3 location from which
--   Amazon Redshift obtains data. Restrictions are described in the topic
--   for CreateDeliveryStream.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified in <tt>RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.S3Configuration</tt>
--   because the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads from
--   the S3 bucket doesn't support these compression formats.
[$sel:s3Configuration:RedshiftDestinationConfiguration'] :: RedshiftDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>RedshiftDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.
