--   enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is enabled, you
--   can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
--   
--

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedshiftRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data RedshiftRetryOptions
RedshiftRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The length of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery
--   after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the
--   first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis
--   Data Firehose does not retry if the value of
--   <tt>DurationInSeconds</tt> is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery
--   attempt takes longer than the current value.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:RedshiftRetryOptions'] :: RedshiftRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RedshiftRetryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:RedshiftRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The length of time
--   during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery after a failure,
--   starting from the initial request and including the first attempt. The
--   default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis Data Firehose does
--   not retry if the value of <tt>DurationInSeconds</tt> is 0 (zero) or if
--   the first delivery attempt takes longer than the current value.
newRedshiftRetryOptions :: RedshiftRetryOptions

-- | The length of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery
--   after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the
--   first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis
--   Data Firehose does not retry if the value of
--   <tt>DurationInSeconds</tt> is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery
--   attempt takes longer than the current value.
redshiftRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' RedshiftRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to an Amazon S3 prefix.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data RetryOptions
RetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> RetryOptions

-- | The period of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to
--   deliver data to the specified Amazon S3 prefix.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:RetryOptions'] :: RetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RetryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:RetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>retryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The period of time during
--   which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to deliver data to the specified
--   Amazon S3 prefix.
newRetryOptions :: RetryOptions

-- | The period of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to
--   deliver data to the specified Amazon S3 prefix.
retryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' RetryOptions (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3DestinationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data S3DestinationConfiguration
S3DestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat -> Maybe BufferingHints -> Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH" time format prefix is automatically used for
--   delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as
--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:prefix:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed
--   records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately
--   following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this
--   prefix, see <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
[$sel:errorOutputPrefix:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.
--   
--   The compression formats <tt>SNAPPY</tt> or <tt>ZIP</tt> cannot be
--   specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not
--   supported by the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> operation that reads
--   from the S3 bucket.
[$sel:compressionFormat:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CompressionFormat

-- | The buffering option. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>BufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
[$sel:bufferingHints:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Maybe BufferingHints

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service
--   Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:roleARN:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
[$sel:bucketARN:S3DestinationConfiguration'] :: S3DestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3DestinationConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   <tt>UNCOMPRESSED</tt>.

--   AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newS3DestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration

--   described in <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.

--   Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
s3DestinationConfiguration_bucketARN :: Lens' S3DestinationConfiguration Text

-- | Specifies the schema to which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   configure your data before it writes it to Amazon S3. This parameter
--   is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSchemaConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SchemaConfiguration
SchemaConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SchemaConfiguration

-- | Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don't
--   specify this version ID, or if you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any
--   updates to the table are automatically picked up.
[$sel:versionId:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the AWS Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS
--   account ID is used by default.
[$sel:catalogId:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the name of the AWS Glue database that contains the schema
--   for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
[$sel:databaseName:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | If you don't specify an AWS Region, the default is the current Region.
[$sel:region:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue table that contains the column information that
--   constitutes your data schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
[$sel:tableName:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This
--   role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   Cross-account roles aren't allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
[$sel:roleARN:SchemaConfiguration'] :: SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SchemaConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_versionId</a> - Specifies the table version for
--   the output data schema. If you don't specify this version ID, or if
--   you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose uses the most
--   recent version. This means that any updates to the table are
--   automatically picked up.
--   
--   <a>$sel:catalogId:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_catalogId</a> - The ID of the AWS Glue Data
--   Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS account ID is used by
--   default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_databaseName</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   AWS Glue database that contains the schema for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_region</a> - If you don't specify an AWS
--   Region, the default is the current Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_tableName</a> - Specifies the AWS Glue table
--   that contains the column information that constitutes your data
--   schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:SchemaConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>schemaConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The role that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This role must be in the same
--   account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose. Cross-account roles aren't
--   allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
newSchemaConfiguration :: SchemaConfiguration

-- | Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don't
--   specify this version ID, or if you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any
--   updates to the table are automatically picked up.
schemaConfiguration_versionId :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the AWS Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS
--   account ID is used by default.
schemaConfiguration_catalogId :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the AWS Glue database that contains the schema
--   for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
schemaConfiguration_databaseName :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | If you don't specify an AWS Region, the default is the current Region.
schemaConfiguration_region :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue table that contains the column information that
--   constitutes your data schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
schemaConfiguration_tableName :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This
--   role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   Cross-account roles aren't allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
schemaConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert
--   data to the target format before writing it to Amazon S3. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose supports two types of serializers: the <a>ORC SerDe</a> and
--   the <a>Parquet SerDe</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSerializer</a> smart constructor.
data Serializer
Serializer' :: Maybe OrcSerDe -> Maybe ParquetSerDe -> Serializer

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
[$sel:orcSerDe:Serializer'] :: Serializer -> Maybe OrcSerDe

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
[$sel:parquetSerDe:Serializer'] :: Serializer -> Maybe ParquetSerDe

-- | Create a value of <a>Serializer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:orcSerDe:Serializer'</a>, <a>serializer_orcSerDe</a> - A
--   serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before storing
--   it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parquetSerDe:Serializer'</a>, <a>serializer_parquetSerDe</a> -
--   A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
newSerializer :: Serializer

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
serializer_orcSerDe :: Lens' Serializer (Maybe OrcSerDe)

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
serializer_parquetSerDe :: Lens' Serializer (Maybe ParquetSerDe)

-- | Details about a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSourceDescription</a> smart constructor.
data SourceDescription
SourceDescription' :: Maybe KinesisStreamSourceDescription -> SourceDescription

-- | The KinesisStreamSourceDescription value for the source Kinesis data
--   stream.
[$sel:kinesisStreamSourceDescription:SourceDescription'] :: SourceDescription -> Maybe KinesisStreamSourceDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>SourceDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisStreamSourceDescription:SourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>sourceDescription_kinesisStreamSourceDescription</a> - The
--   KinesisStreamSourceDescription value for the source Kinesis data
--   stream.
newSourceDescription :: SourceDescription

-- | The KinesisStreamSourceDescription value for the source Kinesis data
--   stream.
sourceDescription_kinesisStreamSourceDescription :: Lens' SourceDescription (Maybe KinesisStreamSourceDescription)

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SplunkDestinationConfiguration
SplunkDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Text -> HECEndpointType -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationConfiguration

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data that
--   could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set
--   to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming
--   records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3.
--   The default value is <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
[$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe Natural

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
[$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
[$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
[$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> HECEndpointType

-- | This is a GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you
--   create a new HEC endpoint.
[$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> Text

-- | The configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
[$sel:s3Configuration:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'] :: SplunkDestinationConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - Defines how
--   documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data that
--   could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set
--   to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming
--   records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3.
--   The default value is <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds</a>
--   - The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to
--   Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt from
--   Splunk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> - The
--   data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECEndpoint</a> - The HTTP Event
--   Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose sends your
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECEndpointType</a> - This type can
--   be either "Raw" or "Event."
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECToken</a> - This is a GUID that
--   you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:SplunkDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> - The
--   configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
newSplunkDestinationConfiguration :: Text -> HECEndpointType -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationConfiguration

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data that
--   could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set
--   to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming
--   records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3.
--   The default value is <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe Natural)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe SplunkRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECEndpoint :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECEndpointType :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration HECEndpointType

-- | This is a GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you
--   create a new HEC endpoint.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECToken :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Describes a destination in Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkDestinationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data SplunkDestinationDescription
SplunkDestinationDescription' :: Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HECEndpointType -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationDescription

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode

-- | A GUID you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC
--   endpoint.
[$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
[$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe HECEndpointType

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
[$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.&gt;
[$sel:s3DestinationDescription:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
[$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
[$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationDescription'] :: SplunkDestinationDescription -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_s3BackupMode</a> - Defines how
--   documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
--

--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_hECToken</a> - A GUID you obtain from
--   your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_hECEndpointType</a> - This type can be
--   either "Raw" or "Event."
--

--   Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--

--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds</a>
--   - The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3DestinationDescription:SplunkDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_s3DestinationDescription</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 destination.&gt;
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_hECEndpoint</a> - The HTTP Event
--   Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose sends your
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_retryOptions</a> - The retry behavior
--   in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to Splunk or

--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationDescription_processingConfiguration</a> - The data
--   processing configuration.
newSplunkDestinationDescription :: SplunkDestinationDescription

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.

--   endpoint.

splunkDestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

splunkDestinationDescription_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkDestinationUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data SplunkDestinationUpdate
SplunkDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HECEndpointType -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> SplunkDestinationUpdate

-- | Specifies how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to
--   Amazon S3. When set to <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured
--   Amazon S3 destination. When set to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes
--   failed documents to Amazon S3. The default value is
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
[$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode

-- | A GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new
--   HEC endpoint.
[$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
[$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe HECEndpointType

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
[$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
[$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Natural

-- | Your update to the configuration of the backup Amazon S3 location.
[$sel:s3Update:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
[$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
[$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The data processing configuration.
[$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationUpdate'] :: SplunkDestinationUpdate -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkDestinationUpdate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode</a> - Specifies how you want
--   Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to
--   Amazon S3. The default value is <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECToken:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_hECToken</a> - A GUID that you obtain from
--   your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECEndpointType:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_hECEndpointType</a> - This type can be
--   either "Raw" or "Event."
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The Amazon
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds</a> - The
--   amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Update:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_s3Update</a> - Your update to the
--   configuration of the backup Amazon S3 location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hECEndpoint:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_hECEndpoint</a> - The HTTP Event Collector
--   (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose sends your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_retryOptions</a> - The retry behavior in
--   case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to Splunk or if
--   it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt from Splunk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:SplunkDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>splunkDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration</a> - The data
--   processing configuration.
newSplunkDestinationUpdate :: SplunkDestinationUpdate

-- | Specifies how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to
--   Amazon S3. When set to <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured
--   Amazon S3 destination. When set to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes
--   failed documents to Amazon S3. The default value is
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
splunkDestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode)

-- | A GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new
--   HEC endpoint.
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECToken :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECEndpointType :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe HECEndpointType)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
splunkDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe Natural)

-- | Your update to the configuration of the backup Amazon S3 location.
splunkDestinationUpdate_s3Update :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe S3DestinationUpdate)

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECEndpoint :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
splunkDestinationUpdate_retryOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe SplunkRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
splunkDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSplunkRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SplunkRetryOptions
SplunkRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk
--   fails. It doesn't include the periods during which Kinesis Data
--   Firehose waits for acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:SplunkRetryOptions'] :: SplunkRetryOptions -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>SplunkRetryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:SplunkRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>splunkRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The total amount of time
--   that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries. This duration starts
--   after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk fails. It doesn't
--   include the periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
newSplunkRetryOptions :: SplunkRetryOptions

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk
--   fails. It doesn't include the periods during which Kinesis Data
--   Firehose waits for acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
splunkRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)

-- | Metadata that you can assign to a delivery stream, consisting of a
--   key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | An optional string, which you can use to describe or define the tag.
--   Maximum length: 256 characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters,
--   digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid
--   characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - An optional string, which
--   you can use to describe or define the tag. Maximum length: 256
--   characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _
--   . / = + - % @
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid characters: Unicode
--   letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | An optional string, which you can use to describe or define the tag.
--   Maximum length: 256 characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters,
--   digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid
--   characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VpcConfiguration
VpcConfiguration' :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> VpcConfiguration

-- | The IDs of the subnets that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that
--   the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to
--   flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that
--   have the destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified
--   here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfiguration'] :: VpcConfiguration -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
[$sel:roleARN:VpcConfiguration'] :: VpcConfiguration -> Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   use when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You
--   can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or
--   different ones. If you specify different security groups here, ensure
--   that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's
--   security group. Also ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group
--   allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you
--   use the same security group for both your delivery stream and the
--   Amazon ES domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows
--   HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see
--   <a>Security group rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfiguration'] :: VpcConfiguration -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfiguration_subnetIds</a> - The IDs of the subnets that you
--   want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to create ENIs in the VPC of the
--   Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing tables and inbound
--   and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the subnets whose IDs
--   are specified here to the subnets that have the destination Amazon ES
--   endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at least one ENI in each of
--   the subnets that are specified here. Do not delete or modify these
--   ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:VpcConfiguration'</a>, <a>vpcConfiguration_roleARN</a>
--   - The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfiguration_securityGroupIds</a> - The IDs of the security
--   groups that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use when it creates ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the same security
--   group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones. If you specify
--   different security groups here, ensure that they allow outbound HTTPS
--   traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also ensure that the
--   Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic from the
--   security groups specified here. If you use the same security group for
--   both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make sure the
--   security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more information
--   about security group rules, see <a>Security group rules</a> in the
--   Amazon VPC documentation.
newVpcConfiguration :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> VpcConfiguration

-- | The IDs of the subnets that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that
--   the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to
--   flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that
--   have the destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified
--   here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
vpcConfiguration_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>

--   </ul>

vpcConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' VpcConfiguration Text

--   that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's
--   security group. Also ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group
--   allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you
--   use the same security group for both your delivery stream and the
--   Amazon ES domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows
--   HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see
--   <a>Security group rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
vpcConfiguration_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcConfigurationDescription</a> smart constructor.
data VpcConfigurationDescription
VpcConfigurationDescription' :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> Text -> VpcConfigurationDescription

-- | The IDs of the subnets that Kinesis Data Firehose uses to create ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing
--   tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the
--   subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the
--   destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at
--   least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not
--   delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
[$sel:subnetIds:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that the delivery stream uses to create
--   endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either
--   case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose service
--   principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
[$sel:roleARN:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that Kinesis Data Firehose uses when it
--   creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the
--   same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones.
--   If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow
--   outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also
--   ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic
--   from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security
--   group for both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make
--   sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more
--   information about security group rules, see <a>Security group
--   rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon ES destination's VPC.
[$sel:vpcId:VpcConfigurationDescription'] :: VpcConfigurationDescription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcConfigurationDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

vpcConfigurationDescription_vpcId :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription Text


-- | Adds or updates tags for the specified delivery stream. A tag is a
--   key-value pair that you can define and assign to AWS resources. If you
--   specify a tag that already exists, the tag value is replaced with the
--   value that you specify in the request. Tags are metadata. For example,
--   you can add friendly names and descriptions or other types of
--   information that can help you distinguish the delivery stream. For
--   more information about tags, see <a>Using Cost Allocation Tags</a> in
--   the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Each delivery stream can have up to 50 tags.
--   
--   This operation has a limit of five transactions per second per
--   account.
module Amazonka.Firehose.TagDeliveryStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagDeliveryStream</a> smart constructor.
data TagDeliveryStream
TagDeliveryStream' :: Text -> NonEmpty Tag -> TagDeliveryStream

-- | The name of the delivery stream to which you want to add the tags.
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:TagDeliveryStream'] :: TagDeliveryStream -> Text

-- | A set of key-value pairs to use to create the tags.
[$sel:tags:TagDeliveryStream'] :: TagDeliveryStream -> NonEmpty Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>TagDeliveryStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:TagDeliveryStream'</a>,
--   <a>tagDeliveryStream_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of the delivery
--   stream to which you want to add the tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagDeliveryStream'</a>, <a>tagDeliveryStream_tags</a> - A
--   set of key-value pairs to use to create the tags.
newTagDeliveryStream :: Text -> NonEmpty Tag -> TagDeliveryStream

-- | The name of the delivery stream to which you want to add the tags.

-- | Disables server-side encryption (SSE) for the delivery stream.
--   
--   This operation is asynchronous. It returns immediately. When you
--   invoke it, Kinesis Data Firehose first sets the encryption status of
--   the stream to <tt>DISABLING</tt>, and then to <tt>DISABLED</tt>. You
--   can continue to read and write data to your stream while its status is
--   <tt>DISABLING</tt>. It can take up to 5 seconds after the encryption
--   status changes to <tt>DISABLED</tt> before all records written to the
--   delivery stream are no longer subject to encryption. To find out
--   whether a record or a batch of records was encrypted, check the
--   response elements PutRecordOutput$Encrypted and
--   PutRecordBatchOutput$Encrypted, respectively.
--   
--   To check the encryption state of a delivery stream, use
--   DescribeDeliveryStream.
--   
--   If SSE is enabled using a customer managed CMK and then you invoke
--   <tt>StopDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose schedules
--   the related KMS grant for retirement and then retires it after it
--   ensures that it is finished delivering records to the destination.
--   
--   The <tt>StartDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> and
--   <tt>StopDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> operations have a combined limit
--   of 25 calls per delivery stream per 24 hours. For example, you reach
--   the limit if you call <tt>StartDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> 13 times
--   and <tt>StopDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> 12 times for the same
--   delivery stream in a 24-hour period.
module Amazonka.Firehose.StopDeliveryStreamEncryption

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopDeliveryStreamEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data StopDeliveryStreamEncryption
StopDeliveryStreamEncryption' :: Text -> StopDeliveryStreamEncryption

-- | The name of the delivery stream for which you want to disable
--   server-side encryption (SSE).
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:StopDeliveryStreamEncryption'] :: StopDeliveryStreamEncryption -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopDeliveryStreamEncryption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:StopDeliveryStreamEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>stopDeliveryStreamEncryption_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of
--   the delivery stream for which you want to disable server-side
--   encryption (SSE).
newStopDeliveryStreamEncryption :: Text -> StopDeliveryStreamEncryption

-- | The name of the delivery stream for which you want to disable
--   server-side encryption (SSE).
stopDeliveryStreamEncryption_deliveryStreamName :: Lens' StopDeliveryStreamEncryption Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopDeliveryStreamEncryptionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StopDeliveryStreamEncryptionResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:StopDeliveryStreamEncryptionResponse'] :: StopDeliveryStreamEncryptionResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StopDeliveryStreamEncryptionResponse'</a>,

--   response's http status code.

instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Firehose.StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.StopDeliveryStreamEncryption


-- | Enables server-side encryption (SSE) for the delivery stream.
--   
--   This operation is asynchronous. It returns immediately. When you
--   invoke it, Kinesis Data Firehose first sets the encryption status of
--   the stream to <tt>ENABLING</tt>, and then to <tt>ENABLED</tt>. The
--   encryption status of a delivery stream is the <tt>Status</tt> property
--   in DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration. If the operation fails, the
--   encryption status changes to <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt>. You can
--   continue to read and write data to your delivery stream while the
--   encryption status is <tt>ENABLING</tt>, but the data is not encrypted.
--   It can take up to 5 seconds after the encryption status changes to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> before all records written to the delivery stream are
--   encrypted. To find out whether a record or a batch of records was
--   encrypted, check the response elements PutRecordOutput$Encrypted and
--   PutRecordBatchOutput$Encrypted, respectively.
--   
--   To check the encryption status of a delivery stream, use
--   DescribeDeliveryStream.
--   
--   Even if encryption is currently enabled for a delivery stream, you can
--   still invoke this operation on it to change the ARN of the CMK or both
--   its type and ARN. If you invoke this method to change the CMK, and the
--   old CMK is of type <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose schedules the grant it had on the old CMK for retirement. If
--   the new CMK is of type <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose creates a grant that enables it to use the new CMK to encrypt
--   and decrypt data and to manage the grant.
--   
--   If a delivery stream already has encryption enabled and then you
--   invoke this operation to change the ARN of the CMK or both its type
--   and ARN and you get <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt>, this only means that the
--   attempt to change the CMK failed. In this case, encryption remains
--   enabled with the old CMK.
--   
--   If the encryption status of your delivery stream is
--   <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt>, you can invoke this operation again with a
--   valid CMK. The CMK must be enabled and the key policy mustn't
--   explicitly deny the permission for Kinesis Data Firehose to invoke KMS
--   encrypt and decrypt operations.
--   
--   You can enable SSE for a delivery stream only if it's a delivery
--   stream that uses <tt>DirectPut</tt> as its source.
--   
--   The <tt>StartDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> and
--   <tt>StopDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> operations have a combined limit
--   of 25 calls per delivery stream per 24 hours. For example, you reach
--   the limit if you call <tt>StartDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> 13 times
--   and <tt>StopDeliveryStreamEncryption</tt> 12 times for the same
--   delivery stream in a 24-hour period.
module Amazonka.Firehose.StartDeliveryStreamEncryption

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartDeliveryStreamEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data StartDeliveryStreamEncryption
StartDeliveryStreamEncryption' :: Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput -> Text -> StartDeliveryStreamEncryption

--   needed for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).

-- | The name of the delivery stream for which you want to enable
--   server-side encryption (SSE).

-- | Create a value of <a>StartDeliveryStreamEncryption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput:StartDeliveryStreamEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>startDeliveryStreamEncryption_deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput</a>
--   - Used to specify the type and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS
--   key needed for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:StartDeliveryStreamEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>startDeliveryStreamEncryption_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of
--   the delivery stream for which you want to enable server-side
--   encryption (SSE).

instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Firehose.StartDeliveryStreamEncryption.StartDeliveryStreamEncryption


-- | Writes multiple data records into a delivery stream in a single call,
--   which can achieve higher throughput per producer than when writing
--   single records. To write single data records into a delivery stream,
--   use PutRecord. Applications using these operations are referred to as
--   producers.
--   
--   For information about service quota, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose Quota</a>.
--   
--   Each PutRecordBatch request supports up to 500 records. Each record in
--   the request can be as large as 1,000 KB (before base64 encoding), up
--   to a limit of 4 MB for the entire request. These limits cannot be
--   changed.
--   
--   You must specify the name of the delivery stream and the data record
--   when using PutRecord. The data record consists of a data blob that can
--   be up to 1,000 KB in size, and any kind of data. For example, it could
--   be a segment from a log file, geographic location data, website
--   clickstream data, and so on.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose buffers records before delivering them to the
--   destination. To disambiguate the data blobs at the destination, a
--   common solution is to use delimiters in the data, such as a newline
--   (<tt>\n</tt>) or some other character unique within the data. This
--   allows the consumer application to parse individual data items when
--   reading the data from the destination.
--   
--   The PutRecordBatch response includes a count of failed records,
--   <tt>FailedPutCount</tt>, and an array of responses,
--   <tt>RequestResponses</tt>. Even if the PutRecordBatch call succeeds,
--   the value of <tt>FailedPutCount</tt> may be greater than 0, indicating
--   that there are records for which the operation didn't succeed. Each
--   entry in the <tt>RequestResponses</tt> array provides additional
--   information about the processed record. It directly correlates with a
--   record in the request array using the same ordering, from the top to
--   the bottom. The response array always includes the same number of
--   records as the request array. <tt>RequestResponses</tt> includes both
--   successfully and unsuccessfully processed records. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose tries to process all records in each PutRecordBatch request.
--   A single record failure does not stop the processing of subsequent
--   records.
--   
--   A successfully processed record includes a <tt>RecordId</tt> value,
--   which is unique for the record. An unsuccessfully processed record
--   includes <tt>ErrorCode</tt> and <tt>ErrorMessage</tt> values.
--   <tt>ErrorCode</tt> reflects the type of error, and is one of the
--   following values: <tt>ServiceUnavailableException</tt> or
--   <tt>InternalFailure</tt>. <tt>ErrorMessage</tt> provides more detailed
--   information about the error.
--   
--   If there is an internal server error or a timeout, the write might
--   have completed or it might have failed. If <tt>FailedPutCount</tt> is
--   greater than 0, retry the request, resending only those records that
--   might have failed processing. This minimizes the possible duplicate
--   records and also reduces the total bytes sent (and corresponding
--   charges). We recommend that you handle any duplicates at the
--   destination.
--   
--   If PutRecordBatch throws <tt>ServiceUnavailableException</tt>, back
--   off and retry. If the exception persists, it is possible that the
--   throughput limits have been exceeded for the delivery stream.
--   
--   Data records sent to Kinesis Data Firehose are stored for 24 hours
--   from the time they are added to a delivery stream as it attempts to
--   send the records to the destination. If the destination is unreachable
--   for more than 24 hours, the data is no longer available.
--   
--   Don't concatenate two or more base64 strings to form the data fields
--   of your records. Instead, concatenate the raw data, then perform
--   base64 encoding.
module Amazonka.Firehose.PutRecordBatch

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecordBatch</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecordBatch
PutRecordBatch' :: Text -> NonEmpty Record -> PutRecordBatch

-- | The name of the delivery stream.
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:PutRecordBatch'] :: PutRecordBatch -> Text

-- | One or more records.
[$sel:records:PutRecordBatch'] :: PutRecordBatch -> NonEmpty Record

-- | Create a value of <a>PutRecordBatch</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:PutRecordBatch'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatch_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of the delivery
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:PutRecordBatch'</a>, <a>putRecordBatch_records</a> -
--   One or more records.
newPutRecordBatch :: Text -> NonEmpty Record -> PutRecordBatch

-- | The name of the delivery stream.
putRecordBatch_deliveryStreamName :: Lens' PutRecordBatch Text

-- | One or more records.
putRecordBatch_records :: Lens' PutRecordBatch (NonEmpty Record)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecordBatchResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecordBatchResponse
PutRecordBatchResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Int -> Natural -> NonEmpty PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> PutRecordBatchResponse

-- | Indicates whether server-side encryption (SSE) was enabled during this
--   operation.
[$sel:encrypted:PutRecordBatchResponse'] :: PutRecordBatchResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:PutRecordBatchResponse'] :: PutRecordBatchResponse -> Int

-- | The number of records that might have failed processing. This number
--   might be greater than 0 even if the PutRecordBatch call succeeds.
--   Check <tt>FailedPutCount</tt> to determine whether there are records
--   that you need to resend.
[$sel:failedPutCount:PutRecordBatchResponse'] :: PutRecordBatchResponse -> Natural

-- | The results array. For each record, the index of the response element
--   is the same as the index used in the request array.
[$sel:requestResponses:PutRecordBatchResponse'] :: PutRecordBatchResponse -> NonEmpty PutRecordBatchResponseEntry

-- | Create a value of <a>PutRecordBatchResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:PutRecordBatchResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponse_encrypted</a> - Indicates whether
--   server-side encryption (SSE) was enabled during this operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutRecordBatchResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedPutCount:PutRecordBatchResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponse_failedPutCount</a> - The number of records
--   that might have failed processing. This number might be greater than 0
--   even if the PutRecordBatch call succeeds. Check
--   <tt>FailedPutCount</tt> to determine whether there are records that
--   you need to resend.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestResponses:PutRecordBatchResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putRecordBatchResponse_requestResponses</a> - The results array.
--   For each record, the index of the response element is the same as the
--   index used in the request array.
newPutRecordBatchResponse :: Int -> Natural -> NonEmpty PutRecordBatchResponseEntry -> PutRecordBatchResponse

-- | Indicates whether server-side encryption (SSE) was enabled during this
--   operation.

--   might be greater than 0 even if the PutRecordBatch call succeeds.
--   Check <tt>FailedPutCount</tt> to determine whether there are records
--   that you need to resend.
putRecordBatchResponse_failedPutCount :: Lens' PutRecordBatchResponse Natural

-- | The results array. For each record, the index of the response element
--   is the same as the index used in the request array.
putRecordBatchResponse_requestResponses :: Lens' PutRecordBatchResponse (NonEmpty PutRecordBatchResponseEntry)

instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Firehose.PutRecordBatch.PutRecordBatch
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Firehose.PutRecordBatch.PutRecordBatch
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Firehose.PutRecordBatch.PutRecordBatch
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Firehose.PutRecordBatch.PutRecordBatch


-- | Writes a single data record into an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivery stream. To write multiple data records into a delivery
--   stream, use PutRecordBatch. Applications using these operations are
--   referred to as producers.
--   
--   By default, each delivery stream can take in up to 2,000 transactions
--   per second, 5,000 records per second, or 5 MB per second. If you use
--   PutRecord and PutRecordBatch, the limits are an aggregate across these
--   two operations for each delivery stream. For more information about
--   limits and how to request an increase, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data
--   Firehose Limits</a>.
--   
--   You must specify the name of the delivery stream and the data record
--   when using PutRecord. The data record consists of a data blob that can
--   be up to 1,000 KiB in size, and any kind of data. For example, it can
--   be a segment from a log file, geographic location data, website
--   clickstream data, and so on.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose buffers records before delivering them to the
--   destination. To disambiguate the data blobs at the destination, a
--   common solution is to use delimiters in the data, such as a newline
--   (<tt>\n</tt>) or some other character unique within the data. This
--   allows the consumer application to parse individual data items when
--   reading the data from the destination.
--   
--   The <tt>PutRecord</tt> operation returns a <tt>RecordId</tt>, which is
--   a unique string assigned to each record. Producer applications can use
--   this ID for purposes such as auditability and investigation.
--   
--   If the <tt>PutRecord</tt> operation throws a
--   <tt>ServiceUnavailableException</tt>, back off and retry. If the
--   exception persists, it is possible that the throughput limits have
--   been exceeded for the delivery stream.
--   
--   Data records sent to Kinesis Data Firehose are stored for 24 hours
--   from the time they are added to a delivery stream as it tries to send
--   the records to the destination. If the destination is unreachable for
--   more than 24 hours, the data is no longer available.
--   
--   Don't concatenate two or more base64 strings to form the data fields
--   of your records. Instead, concatenate the raw data, then perform
--   base64 encoding.
module Amazonka.Firehose.PutRecord

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecord</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecord
PutRecord' :: Text -> Record -> PutRecord

-- | The name of the delivery stream.
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:PutRecord'] :: PutRecord -> Text

-- | The record.
[$sel:record:PutRecord'] :: PutRecord -> Record

-- | Lists the tags for the specified delivery stream. This operation has a
--   limit of five transactions per second per account.
module Amazonka.Firehose.ListTagsForDeliveryStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForDeliveryStream</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForDeliveryStream
ListTagsForDeliveryStream' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ListTagsForDeliveryStream

-- | The number of tags to return. If this number is less than the total
--   number of tags associated with the delivery stream,
--   <tt>HasMoreTags</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> in the response. To list
--   additional tags, set <tt>ExclusiveStartTagKey</tt> to the last key in
--   the response.
