s3DestinationUpdate_roleARN :: Lens' S3DestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don't
--   specify this version ID, or if you set it to <tt>LATEST</tt>, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any
--   updates to the table are automatically picked up.
schemaConfiguration_versionId :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the AWS Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the AWS
--   account ID is used by default.
schemaConfiguration_catalogId :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the name of the AWS Glue database that contains the schema
--   for the output data.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>DatabaseName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
schemaConfiguration_databaseName :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | If you don't specify an AWS Region, the default is the current Region.
schemaConfiguration_region :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the AWS Glue table that contains the column information that
--   constitutes your data schema.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>TableName</tt> property is required and its value must be
--   specified.
schemaConfiguration_tableName :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access AWS Glue. This
--   role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   Cross-account roles aren't allowed.
--   
--   If the <tt>SchemaConfiguration</tt> request parameter is used as part
--   of invoking the <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> API, then the
--   <tt>RoleARN</tt> property is required and its value must be specified.
schemaConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' SchemaConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache ORC</a>.
serializer_orcSerDe :: Lens' Serializer (Maybe OrcSerDe)

-- | A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before
--   storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Apache
--   Parquet</a>.
serializer_parquetSerDe :: Lens' Serializer (Maybe ParquetSerDe)

-- | The KinesisStreamSourceDescription value for the source Kinesis data
--   stream.
sourceDescription_kinesisStreamSourceDescription :: Lens' SourceDescription (Maybe KinesisStreamSourceDescription)

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data that
--   could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set
--   to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming
--   records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3.
--   The default value is <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe Natural)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk, or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe SplunkRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECEndpoint :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECEndpointType :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration HECEndpointType

-- | This is a GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you
--   create a new HEC endpoint.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_hECToken :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
splunkDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationConfiguration S3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data
--   that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination.
--   When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all
--   incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
splunkDestinationDescription_s3BackupMode :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode)

-- | A GUID you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC
--   endpoint.
splunkDestinationDescription_hECToken :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
splunkDestinationDescription_hECEndpointType :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe HECEndpointType)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
splunkDestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
splunkDestinationDescription_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon S3 destination.&gt;
splunkDestinationDescription_s3DestinationDescription :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe S3DestinationDescription)

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
splunkDestinationDescription_hECEndpoint :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
splunkDestinationDescription_retryOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe SplunkRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
splunkDestinationDescription_processingConfiguration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationDescription (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | Specifies how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to
--   Amazon S3. When set to <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured
--   Amazon S3 destination. When set to <tt>AllEvents</tt>, Kinesis Data
--   Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes
--   failed documents to Amazon S3. The default value is
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can update this backup mode from <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt> to
--   <tt>AllEvents</tt>. You can't update it from <tt>AllEvents</tt> to
--   <tt>FailedEventsOnly</tt>.
splunkDestinationUpdate_s3BackupMode :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe SplunkS3BackupMode)

-- | A GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new
--   HEC endpoint.
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECToken :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | This type can be either "Raw" or "Event."
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECEndpointType :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe HECEndpointType)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
splunkDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions)

-- | The amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose waits to receive an
--   acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends data. At the end of the
--   timeout period, Kinesis Data Firehose either tries to send the data
--   again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe Natural)

-- | Your update to the configuration of the backup Amazon S3 location.
splunkDestinationUpdate_s3Update :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe S3DestinationUpdate)

-- | The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Data Firehose
--   sends your data.
splunkDestinationUpdate_hECEndpoint :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt
--   from Splunk.
splunkDestinationUpdate_retryOptions :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe SplunkRetryOptions)

-- | The data processing configuration.
splunkDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration :: Lens' SplunkDestinationUpdate (Maybe ProcessingConfiguration)

-- | The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries.
--   This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk
--   fails. It doesn't include the periods during which Kinesis Data
--   Firehose waits for acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.
splunkRetryOptions_durationInSeconds :: Lens' SplunkRetryOptions (Maybe Natural)

-- | An optional string, which you can use to describe or define the tag.
--   Maximum length: 256 characters. Valid characters: Unicode letters,
--   digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the tag. Maximum length: 128 characters. Valid
--   characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, _ . / = + - % @
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The IDs of the subnets that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that
--   the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to
--   flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that
--   have the destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified
--   here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
vpcConfiguration_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that you want the delivery stream to use to
--   create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing
--   Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In
--   either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose
--   service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
vpcConfiguration_roleARN :: Lens' VpcConfiguration Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   use when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You
--   can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or
--   different ones. If you specify different security groups here, ensure
--   that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's
--   security group. Also ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group
--   allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you
--   use the same security group for both your delivery stream and the
--   Amazon ES domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows
--   HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see
--   <a>Security group rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
vpcConfiguration_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The IDs of the subnets that Kinesis Data Firehose uses to create ENIs
--   in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing
--   tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the
--   subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the
--   destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at
--   least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not
--   delete or modify these ENIs.
--   
--   The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets
--   specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput.
--   To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to
--   match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you
--   calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can
--   create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the
--   subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see
--   <a>Network Interfaces</a> in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.
vpcConfigurationDescription_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that the delivery stream uses to create
--   endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either
--   case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose service
--   principal and that it grants the following permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcs</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSubnets</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream,
--   Kinesis Data Firehose can't scale out by creating more ENIs when
--   necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.
vpcConfigurationDescription_roleARN :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription Text

-- | The IDs of the security groups that Kinesis Data Firehose uses when it
--   creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the
--   same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones.
--   If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow
--   outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain's security group. Also
--   ensure that the Amazon ES domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic
--   from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security
--   group for both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make
--   sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more
--   information about security group rules, see <a>Security group
--   rules</a> in the Amazon VPC documentation.
vpcConfigurationDescription_securityGroupIds :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon ES destination's VPC.
vpcConfigurationDescription_vpcId :: Lens' VpcConfigurationDescription Text


module Amazonka.Firehose.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2015-08-04</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose API Reference
--   
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose is a fully managed service that delivers
--   real-time streaming data to destinations such as Amazon Simple Storage
--   Service (Amazon S3), Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES), Amazon
--   Redshift, and Splunk.
module Amazonka.Firehose

-- | API version <tt>2015-08-04</tt> of the Amazon Kinesis Firehose SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The specified input parameter has a value that is not valid.
_InvalidArgumentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Kinesis Data Firehose throws this exception when an attempt to put
--   records or to start or stop delivery stream encryption fails. This
--   happens when the KMS service throws one of the following exception
--   types: <tt>AccessDeniedException</tt>, <tt>InvalidStateException</tt>,
--   <tt>DisabledException</tt>, or <tt>NotFoundException</tt>.
_InvalidKMSResourceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Another modification has already happened. Fetch <tt>VersionId</tt>
--   again and use it to update the destination.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service is unavailable. Back off and retry the operation. If you
--   continue to see the exception, throughput limits for the delivery
--   stream may have been exceeded. For more information about limits and
--   how to request an increase, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   Limits</a>.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource could not be found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have already reached the limit for a requested resource.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is already in use and not available for this operation.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecord</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecord
PutRecord' :: Text -> Record -> PutRecord

-- | Create a value of <a>PutRecord</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:PutRecord'</a>,
--   <a>putRecord_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of the delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:record:PutRecord'</a>, <a>putRecord_record</a> - The record.
newPutRecord :: Text -> Record -> PutRecord

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutRecordResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PutRecordResponse
PutRecordResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Int -> Text -> PutRecordResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PutRecordResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:PutRecordResponse'</a>,

--   value is null, then the update destination fails. After the update is

--   performs a merge of the old configuration with the new configuration.

--   assign to AWS resources. Tags are metadata. For example, you can add
--   friendly names and descriptions or other types of information that can
--   help you distinguish the delivery stream. For more information about

--   stream directly.</li>

--   data stream as a source.</li>

--   streams of all types are returned.
--

--   <a>listDeliveryStreams_exclusiveStartDeliveryStreamName</a> - The list
--   of delivery streams returned by this call to
--   <tt>ListDeliveryStreams</tt> will start with the delivery stream whose
--   name comes alphabetically immediately after the name you specify in
--   <tt>ExclusiveStartDeliveryStreamName</tt>.
newListDeliveryStreams :: ListDeliveryStreams

--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamNames:ListDeliveryStreamsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listDeliveryStreamsResponse_deliveryStreamNames</a> - The names of
--   the delivery streams.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasMoreDeliveryStreams:ListDeliveryStreamsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listDeliveryStreamsResponse_hasMoreDeliveryStreams</a> - Indicates
--   whether there are more delivery streams available to list.
newListDeliveryStreamsResponse :: Int -> Bool -> ListDeliveryStreamsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDeliveryStream</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDeliveryStream
DeleteDeliveryStream' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteDeliveryStream

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDeliveryStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowForceDelete:DeleteDeliveryStream'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDeliveryStream_allowForceDelete</a> - Set this to true if you
--   want to delete the delivery stream even if Kinesis Data Firehose is
--   unable to retire the grant for the CMK. Kinesis Data Firehose might be
--   unable to retire the grant due to a customer error, such as when the
--   CMK or the grant are in an invalid state. If you force deletion, you
--   can then use the <a>RevokeGrant</a> operation to revoke the grant you
--   gave to Kinesis Data Firehose. If a failure to retire the grant
--   happens due to an AWS KMS issue, Kinesis Data Firehose keeps retrying
--   the delete operation.
--   
--   The default value is false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:DeleteDeliveryStream'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDeliveryStream_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of the
--   delivery stream.
newDeleteDeliveryStream :: Text -> DeleteDeliveryStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDeliveryStreamResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDeliveryStreamResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDeliveryStreamResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteDeliveryStreamResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDeliveryStreamResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDeleteDeliveryStreamResponse :: Int -> DeleteDeliveryStreamResponse

-- | Describes hints for the buffering to perform before delivering data to
--   the destination. These options are treated as hints, and therefore
--   Kinesis Data Firehose might choose to use different values when it is
--   optimal. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data BufferingHints
BufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> BufferingHints

-- | Create a value of <a>BufferingHints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:BufferingHints'</a>, <a>bufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a>
--   - Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before
--   delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This
--   parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also
--   specify a value for <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>, and vice versa.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MiB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MiB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:BufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>bufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming data for the
--   specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the
--   destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but
--   if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt>, and vice versa.
newBufferingHints :: BufferingHints

-- | Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery
--   stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchLoggingOptions
CloudWatchLoggingOptions' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CloudWatchLoggingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLoggingOptions_enabled</a> - Enables or disables
--   CloudWatch logging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupName:CloudWatchLoggingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLoggingOptions_logGroupName</a> - The CloudWatch group
--   name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logStreamName:CloudWatchLoggingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLoggingOptions_logStreamName</a> - The CloudWatch log
--   stream name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging
--   is enabled.
newCloudWatchLoggingOptions :: CloudWatchLoggingOptions

-- | Describes a <tt>COPY</tt> command for Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyCommand</a> smart constructor.
data CopyCommand
CopyCommand' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> CopyCommand

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyCommand</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyOptions:CopyCommand'</a>, <a>copyCommand_copyOptions</a> -
--   Optional parameters to use with the Amazon Redshift <tt>COPY</tt>
--   command. For more information, see the "Optional Parameters" section
--   of <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command</a>. Some possible examples that
--   would apply to Kinesis Data Firehose are as follows:
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '\t' lzop;</tt> - fields are delimited with "\t" (TAB
--   character) and compressed using lzop.
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|'</tt> - fields are delimited with "|" (this is the
--   default delimiter).
--   
--   <tt>delimiter '|' escape</tt> - the delimiter should be escaped.
--   
--   <tt>fixedwidth
--   'venueid:3,venuename:25,venuecity:12,venuestate:2,venueseats:6'</tt> -
--   fields are fixed width in the source, with each width specified after
--   every column in the table.
--   
--   <tt>JSON 's3://mybucket/jsonpaths.txt'</tt> - data is in JSON format,
--   and the path specified is the format of the data.
--   
--   For more examples, see <a>Amazon Redshift COPY command examples</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTableColumns:CopyCommand'</a>,
--   <a>copyCommand_dataTableColumns</a> - A comma-separated list of column
--   names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTableName:CopyCommand'</a>,
--   <a>copyCommand_dataTableName</a> - The name of the target table. The
--   table must already exist in the database.
newCopyCommand :: Text -> CopyCommand

-- | Specifies that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to convert data from the
--   JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon
--   S3. Kinesis Data Firehose uses the serializer and deserializer that
--   you specify, in addition to the column information from the AWS Glue
--   table, to deserialize your input data from JSON and then serialize it
--   to the Parquet or ORC format. For more information, see <a>Kinesis
--   Data Firehose Record Format Conversion</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataFormatConversionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DataFormatConversionConfiguration
DataFormatConversionConfiguration' :: Maybe OutputFormatConfiguration -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe SchemaConfiguration -> Maybe InputFormatConfiguration -> DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>DataFormatConversionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputFormatConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_outputFormatConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to
--   convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_enabled</a> - Defaults to
--   <tt>true</tt>. Set it to <tt>false</tt> if you want to disable format
--   conversion while preserving the configuration details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_schemaConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies the AWS Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column
--   information. This parameter is required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to
--   true.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFormatConfiguration:DataFormatConversionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dataFormatConversionConfiguration_inputFormatConfiguration</a> -
--   Specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use
--   to convert the format of your data from JSON. This parameter is
--   required if <tt>Enabled</tt> is set to true.
newDataFormatConversionConfiguration :: DataFormatConversionConfiguration

-- | Contains information about a delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryStreamDescription</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryStreamDescription
DeliveryStreamDescription' :: Maybe FailureDescription -> Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe SourceDescription -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> DeliveryStreamStatus -> DeliveryStreamType -> Text -> [DestinationDescription] -> Bool -> DeliveryStreamDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryStreamDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDescription:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_failureDescription</a> - Provides details
--   in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related
--   to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</a>
--   - Indicates the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_createTimestamp</a> - The date and time
--   that the delivery stream was created.

--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_source</a> - If the
--   <tt>DeliveryStreamType</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>, a SourceDescription object describing
--   the source Kinesis data stream.
--

--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_lastUpdateTimestamp</a> - The date and
--   time that the delivery stream was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamName</a> - The name of the
--   delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamARN:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamStatus:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamStatus</a> - The status of
--   the delivery stream. If the status of a delivery stream is
--   <tt>CREATING_FAILED</tt>, this status doesn't change, and you can't
--   invoke <tt>CreateDeliveryStream</tt> again on it. However, you can
--   invoke the DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamType:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_deliveryStreamType</a> - The delivery
--   stream type. This can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DirectPut</tt>: Provider applications access the delivery
--   stream directly.</li>
--   <li><tt>KinesisStreamAsSource</tt>: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis
--   data stream as a source.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_versionId</a> - Each time the destination
--   is updated for a delivery stream, the version ID is changed, and the
--   current version ID is required when updating the destination. This is
--   so that the service knows it is applying the changes to the correct
--   version of the delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinations:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_destinations</a> - The destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasMoreDestinations:DeliveryStreamDescription'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamDescription_hasMoreDestinations</a> - Indicates
--   whether there are more destinations available to list.
newDeliveryStreamDescription :: Text -> Text -> DeliveryStreamStatus -> DeliveryStreamType -> Text -> Bool -> DeliveryStreamDescription

-- | Contains information about the server-side encryption (SSE) status for
--   the delivery stream, the type customer master key (CMK) in use, if
--   any, and the ARN of the CMK. You can get
--   <tt>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</tt> by invoking the
--   DescribeDeliveryStream operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe DeliveryStreamEncryptionStatus -> Maybe KeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FailureDescription -> DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_status</a> - This is the
--   server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery stream. For a
--   full description of the different values of this status, see
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption and StopDeliveryStreamEncryption. If
--   this status is <tt>ENABLING_FAILED</tt> or <tt>DISABLING_FAILED</tt>,
--   it is the status of the most recent attempt to enable or disable SSE,
--   respectively.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyType:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_keyType</a> - Indicates the
--   type of customer master key (CMK) that is used for encryption. The
--   default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more information about
--   CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyARN:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_keyARN</a> - If
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> is <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, this field contains
--   the ARN of the customer managed CMK. If <tt>KeyType</tt> is
--   <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, <tt>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration</tt>
--   doesn't contain a value for <tt>KeyARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureDescription:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration_failureDescription</a> -
--   Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration :: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifies the type and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK to use
--   for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput
DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput' :: Maybe Text -> KeyType -> DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyARN:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput_keyARN</a> - If you set
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> to <tt>CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK</tt>, you must specify
--   the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. If you set <tt>KeyType</tt>
--   to <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose uses a
--   service-account CMK.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyType:DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput_keyType</a> - Indicates
--   the type of customer master key (CMK) to use for encryption. The
--   default setting is <tt>AWS_OWNED_CMK</tt>. For more information about
--   CMKs, see <a>Customer Master Keys (CMKs)</a>. When you invoke
--   CreateDeliveryStream or StartDeliveryStreamEncryption with
--   <tt>KeyType</tt> set to CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   invokes the Amazon KMS operation <a>CreateGrant</a> to create a grant
--   that allows the Kinesis Data Firehose service to use the customer
--   managed CMK to perform encryption and decryption. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose manages that grant.
--   
--   When you invoke StartDeliveryStreamEncryption to change the CMK for a
--   delivery stream that is encrypted with a customer managed CMK, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose schedules the grant it had on the old CMK for
--   retirement.
--   
--   You can use a CMK of type CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK to encrypt up to 500
--   delivery streams. If a CreateDeliveryStream or
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption operation exceeds this limit, Kinesis
--   Data Firehose throws a <tt>LimitExceededException</tt>.
--   
--   To encrypt your delivery stream, use symmetric CMKs. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose doesn't support asymmetric CMKs. For information about
--   symmetric and asymmetric CMKs, see <a>About Symmetric and Asymmetric
--   CMKs</a> in the AWS Key Management Service developer guide.
newDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput :: KeyType -> DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput

-- | The deserializer you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use for converting
--   the input data from JSON. Kinesis Data Firehose then serializes the
--   data to its final format using the Serializer. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   supports two types of deserializers: the <a>Apache Hive JSON SerDe</a>
--   and the <a>OpenX JSON SerDe</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeserializer</a> smart constructor.
data Deserializer
Deserializer' :: Maybe OpenXJsonSerDe -> Maybe HiveJsonSerDe -> Deserializer

-- | Create a value of <a>Deserializer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openXJsonSerDe:Deserializer'</a>,
--   <a>deserializer_openXJsonSerDe</a> - The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis
--   Data Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from
--   the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or
--   ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending
--   on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is
--   the native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hiveJsonSerDe:Deserializer'</a>,
--   <a>deserializer_hiveJsonSerDe</a> - The native Hive / HCatalog
--   JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data, which
--   means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for
--   serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two
--   deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the
--   functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX SerDe.
newDeserializer :: Deserializer

-- | The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamicPartitioningConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
DynamicPartitioningConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe RetryOptions -> DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamicPartitioningConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   dynamic partitioning is enabled for this Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:DynamicPartitioningConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>dynamicPartitioningConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to an
--   Amazon S3 prefix.
newDynamicPartitioningConfiguration :: DynamicPartitioningConfiguration

-- | Describes the buffering to perform before delivering data to the
--   Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchBufferingHints
ElasticsearchBufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:ElasticsearchBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchBufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a> - Buffer incoming data to
--   the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination.
--   The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:ElasticsearchBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming
--   data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
newElasticsearchBufferingHints :: ElasticsearchBufferingHints

-- | Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration
ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe VpcConfiguration -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_indexRotationPeriod</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to the <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of
--   old data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon
--   ES Destination</a>. The default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_typeName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one
--   type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index
--   that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error
--   during run time.
--   
--   For Elasticsearch 7.x, don't specify a <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - Defines
--   how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set to
--   <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any
--   documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3
--   destination, with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the key
--   prefix. When set to <tt>AllDocuments</tt>, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed
--   documents with <tt>elasticsearch-failed/</tt> appended to the prefix.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Backup for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>FailedDocumentsOnly</tt>.
--   
--   You can't change this backup mode after you create the delivery
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_domainARN</a> - The ARN of
--   the Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions for
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the role
--   specified in <b>RoleARN</b>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a>
--   - The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_vpcConfiguration</a> - The
--   details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values for
--   <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents
--   to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   The data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_clusterEndpoint</a> - The
--   endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify either
--   this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data
--   Firehose for calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and for indexing
--   documents. For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis Data Firehose
--   Access to an Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_indexName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> - The
--   configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.
newElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration

-- | The destination description in Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchDestinationDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ElasticsearchDestinationDescription
ElasticsearchDestinationDescription' :: Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ElasticsearchS3BackupMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VpcConfigurationDescription -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationDescription -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ElasticsearchDestinationDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchDestinationDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_indexRotationPeriod</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index rotation period
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_typeName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch type name. This applies to Elasticsearch 6.x and lower
--   versions. For Elasticsearch 7.x, there's no value for
--   <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_s3BackupMode</a> - The Amazon
--   S3 backup mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_domainARN</a> - The ARN of the
--   Amazon ES domain. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Kinesis Data Firehose uses either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>DomainARN</tt> to send data to Amazon ES.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfigurationDescription:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_vpcConfigurationDescription</a>
--   - The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   The Amazon CloudWatch logging options.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3DestinationDescription:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_s3DestinationDescription</a> -
--   The Amazon S3 destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_retryOptions</a> - The Amazon
--   ES retry options.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   The data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_roleARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_clusterEndpoint</a> - The
--   endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses either this <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the
--   <tt>DomainARN</tt> field to send data to Amazon ES.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationDescription_indexName</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index name.
newElasticsearchDestinationDescription :: ElasticsearchDestinationDescription

-- | Describes an update for a destination in Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchDestinationUpdate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate
ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate' :: Maybe ElasticsearchIndexRotationPeriod -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe S3DestinationUpdate -> Maybe ElasticsearchBufferingHints -> Maybe ElasticsearchRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexRotationPeriod:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexRotationPeriod</a> - The
--   Elasticsearch index rotation period. Index rotation appends a
--   timestamp to <tt>IndexName</tt> to facilitate the expiration of old
--   data. For more information, see <a>Index Rotation for the Amazon ES
--   Destination</a>. Default value is <tt>OneDay</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeName:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_typeName</a> - The Elasticsearch
--   type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one type per
--   index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index that
--   already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error
--   during runtime.
--   
--   If you upgrade Elasticsearch from 6.x to 7.x and don’t update your
--   delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose still delivers data to
--   Elasticsearch with the old index name and type name. If you want to
--   update your delivery stream with a new index name, provide an empty
--   string for <tt>TypeName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainARN:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_domainARN</a> - The ARN of the
--   Amazon ES domain. The IAM role must have permissions for
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomain</tt>,
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomains</tt>, and
--   <tt>DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig</tt> after assuming the IAM role
--   specified in <tt>RoleARN</tt>. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   Specify either <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or <tt>DomainARN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> - The
--   CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Update:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_s3Update</a> - The Amazon S3
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_bufferingHints</a> - The buffering
--   options. If no value is specified,
--   <tt>ElasticsearchBufferingHints</tt> object default values are used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_retryOptions</a> - The retry
--   behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents
--   to Amazon ES. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_processingConfiguration</a> - The
--   data processing configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_roleARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data Firehose for
--   calling the Amazon ES Configuration API and for indexing documents.
--   For more information, see <a>Grant Kinesis Data Firehose Access to an
--   Amazon S3 Destination</a> and <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS
--   Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterEndpoint:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_clusterEndpoint</a> - The endpoint
--   to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify either this
--   <tt>ClusterEndpoint</tt> or the <tt>DomainARN</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchDestinationUpdate_indexName</a> - The Elasticsearch
--   index name.
newElasticsearchDestinationUpdate :: ElasticsearchDestinationUpdate

-- | Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to
--   deliver documents to Amazon ES.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchRetryOptions
ElasticsearchRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> ElasticsearchRetryOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchRetryOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:ElasticsearchRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - After an initial
--   failure to deliver to Amazon ES, the total amount of time during which
--   Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including the first attempt).
--   After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to
--   Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A value of 0
--   (zero) results in no retries.
newElasticsearchRetryOptions :: ElasticsearchRetryOptions

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - The Amazon S3
--   backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can update it to
--   enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is enabled, you
--   can't update the delivery stream to disable it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_prefix</a> - The "YYYY/MM/DD/HH"
--   time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3
--   files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in <a>Custom
--   Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--

--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.
--

--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_s3BackupConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration for backup in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorOutputPrefix:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_errorOutputPrefix</a> - A prefix
--   that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before
--   writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the
--   bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see
--   <a>Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_encryptionConfiguration</a> -
--   The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is
--   no encryption.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamicPartitioningConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_dynamicPartitioningConfiguration</a>
--   - The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates
--   smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on
--   partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for
--   Amazon S3 destinations. For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/firehose/latest/dev/dynamic-partitioning.html</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionFormat:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,

--   compression format. If no value is specified, the default is
--   UNCOMPRESSED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering option.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataFormatConversionConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_dataFormatConversionConfiguration</a>
--   - The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from
--   the JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to
--   Amazon S3.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,

--

--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS credentials. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketARN:ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>extendedS3DestinationConfiguration_bucketARN</a> - The ARN of the
--   S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration

-- | Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to
--   an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream,
--   StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureDescription</a> smart constructor.
data FailureDescription
FailureDescription' :: DeliveryStreamFailureType -> Text -> FailureDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':FailureDescription'</a>, <a>failureDescription_type</a>
--   - The type of error that caused the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:FailureDescription'</a>,
--   <a>failureDescription_details</a> - A message providing details about
--   the error that caused the failure.
newFailureDescription :: DeliveryStreamFailureType -> Text -> FailureDescription

-- | The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose
--   for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format
--   in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This
--   is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one
--   offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX
--   SerDe.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHiveJsonSerDe</a> smart constructor.
data HiveJsonSerDe
HiveJsonSerDe' :: Maybe [Text] -> HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Create a value of <a>HiveJsonSerDe</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampFormats:HiveJsonSerDe'</a>,
--   <a>hiveJsonSerDe_timestampFormats</a> - Indicates how you want Kinesis
--   Data Firehose to parse the date and timestamps that may be present in
--   your input data JSON. To specify these format strings, follow the
--   pattern syntax of JodaTime's DateTimeFormat format strings. For more
--   information, see <a>Class DateTimeFormat</a>. You can also use the
--   special value <tt>millis</tt> to parse timestamps in epoch
--   milliseconds. If you don't specify a format, Kinesis Data Firehose
--   uses <tt>java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf</tt> by default.
newHiveJsonSerDe :: HiveJsonSerDe

-- | Describes the buffering options that can be applied before data is
--   delivered to the HTTP endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   treats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>
--   parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them,
--   you must also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointBufferingHints</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointBufferingHints
HttpEndpointBufferingHints' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointBufferingHints</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInMBs:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointBufferingHints_sizeInMBs</a> - Buffer incoming data to
--   the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination.
--   The default value is 5.
--   
--   We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount
--   of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds.
--   For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value
--   should be 10 MB or higher.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:HttpEndpointBufferingHints'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointBufferingHints_intervalInSeconds</a> - Buffer incoming
--   data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering
--   it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).
newHttpEndpointBufferingHints :: HttpEndpointBufferingHints

-- | Describes the metadata that's delivered to the specified HTTP endpoint
--   destination.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointCommonAttribute</a> smart constructor.

--   HTTP endpoint common attribute.
newHttpEndpointCommonAttribute :: Text -> Text -> HttpEndpointCommonAttribute

--   as the destination.

--   selected as the destination.
--   
--   If you choose an HTTP endpoint as your destination, review and follow
--   the instructions in the <a>Appendix - HTTP Endpoint Delivery Request
--   and Response Specifications</a>.
newHttpEndpointConfiguration :: Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration

data HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration
HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe HttpEndpointS3BackupMode -> Maybe CloudWatchLoggingOptions -> Maybe HttpEndpointBufferingHints -> Maybe HttpEndpointRetryOptions -> Maybe ProcessingConfiguration -> Maybe HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> HttpEndpointConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BackupMode:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3BackupMode</a> - Describes
--   the S3 bucket backup options for the data that Kinesis Data Firehose
--   delivers to the HTTP endpoint destination. You can back up all
--   documents (<tt>AllData</tt>) or only the documents that Kinesis Data
--   Firehose could not deliver to the specified HTTP endpoint destination
--   (<tt>FailedDataOnly</tt>).
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLoggingOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_cloudWatchLoggingOptions</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferingHints:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_bufferingHints</a> - The
--   buffering options that can be used before data is delivered to the
--   specified destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as
--   hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The
--   <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt> parameters are
--   optional. However, if you specify a value for one of them, you must
--   also provide a value for the other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryOptions:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_retryOptions</a> - Describes
--   the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver
--   data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it doesn't
--   receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified HTTP
--   endpoint destination.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_processingConfiguration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_requestConfiguration</a> - The
--   configuration of the requeste sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as
--   the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_roleARN</a> - Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that the delivery
--   stream needs.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointConfiguration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_endpointConfiguration</a> -
--   The configuration of the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Configuration:HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration_s3Configuration</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newHttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration :: HttpEndpointConfiguration -> S3DestinationConfiguration -> HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration

--   delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose
--   teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal
--   values. The <tt>SizeInMBs</tt> and <tt>IntervalInSeconds</tt>

--   configuration of request sent to the HTTP endpoint specified as the

--   
--   <a>$sel:roleARN:HttpEndpointDestinationDescription'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointDestinationDescription_roleARN</a> - Kinesis Data
--   Firehose uses this IAM role for all the permissions that the delivery
--   stream needs.
newHttpEndpointDestinationDescription :: HttpEndpointDestinationDescription

newHttpEndpointRequestConfiguration :: HttpEndpointRequestConfiguration

-- | Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable
--   to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it
--   doesn't receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified
--   HTTP endpoint destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpEndpointRetryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data HttpEndpointRetryOptions
HttpEndpointRetryOptions' :: Maybe Natural -> HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpEndpointRetryOptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:HttpEndpointRetryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>httpEndpointRetryOptions_durationInSeconds</a> - The total amount
--   of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries. This duration
--   starts after the initial attempt to send data to the custom
--   destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn't include the periods
--   during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment from the
--   specified destination after each attempt.
newHttpEndpointRetryOptions :: HttpEndpointRetryOptions

-- | Specifies the deserializer you want to use to convert the format of

--   to true.

data InputFormatConfiguration

--   <a>inputFormatConfiguration_deserializer</a> - Specifies which
--   deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache Hive JSON SerDe
--   or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the
--   request.
newInputFormatConfiguration :: InputFormatConfiguration

--   Resource Names (ARNs) and AWS Service Namespaces</a>.
newKMSEncryptionConfig :: Text -> KMSEncryptionConfig

-- | The stream and role Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for a Kinesis data

--   information, see <a>AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN

newKinesisStreamSourceConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration

-- | Details about a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a Kinesis
--   Data Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisStreamSourceDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data KinesisStreamSourceDescription

--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStartTimestamp:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_deliveryStartTimestamp</a> - Kinesis
--   Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data stream
--   starting with this timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisStreamARN:KinesisStreamSourceDescription'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisStreamSourceDescription_kinesisStreamARN</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format</a>.
